It's cute. It's more a series of mostly unconnected events than a story, but I don't mind.

The art is amazing and easily the best part. If you like the art and don't mind the story being a series of events and not really having a middle or end, I think it's worth getting. It's a bit short though, so you might want to get it on sale, or you might think the art makes it worth it anyway. If you don't like the art or want a more serious story, this game probably isn't for you.

Aisia is best girl by the way, and I like Cullen a bit more than Lucia. But really they're all great.

38993490.review:
An absolutely amazing visual novel. I've had tons of fun reading it. The story it tells is really interesting and well built. The voiceacting is wonderful and the songs used really fit well with the overall mood. The characters are all really cute and lovable.
Lucia who is kind and caring and plays a bit tsundere which makes her a really lovable character.
Aisia with her clumsiness and innocence she is the absoulute definition of cuteness.
Cullen who is really cool and easy-going but actually a really caring and thoughtful person.
And Leon the only male character, he is really kind hearted and caring but a bit dense when it comes to the feelings of the girls around him which only makes him more lovable.
All in all this game is fantastic. Totally deserves a 10/10.

38499596.review:
哭着看完第一章的留下一些感想：在第一章中，男主自认为很了解盧莎，结果却相反。艾西亚来工作后，抢了不少盧莎的工作，男主对这样的行为可能会导致对盧莎情绪影响有所察觉，最终还是掠过。直到那天，所谓的不辞而别出现时，男主才感到慌乱，最后找到盧莎时，也不并是因为所谓的抢工作而离开，只是去请假。男主对盧莎的了解还是太少了，在看完那段令人治愈的话后，我觉得没有比她更成熟，更好的女孩子了。在第一章最后，艾西亚神助攻，打破了很久的隔离带，两人关系有所改变。剩下的剧情我没有看，估计会很精彩。(人设非常不错，盧莎拥有着人类所缺乏的美好的品格，这是当前以及以后人类都永远缺乏的品格)(男主真应该成熟了，更应该把握好机会，这么好的女孩子上哪找？)
看完第二章后，照样哭着结束了游戏。男主在最后的时刻没有犹豫，找回了艾西亚，【食物是重要的东西，但总不可能记着每日的食物】就这样，那份心结解开了，艾西亚留了下来。并且过着每天和谐的日常。男主也发誓要维护她，维护每日的平静生活。真心的祝愿他们能够开开心心的过好每日的日常。同时也希望各位能够重视你身边重要的人，不管是风是雨，都不要轻易的抛弃重要的人。karakara这款游戏真心值得入！【第二季我们再会！】

37400411.review:
Na odludziu stoi budynek, w którym mieści się mała jadłodajnia. Posiada ona jedynie dwóch pracowników – właściciela przybytku, Leona, oraz jego niebieskowłosej kompanki, Lucii. Czy dwójka bohaterów znajdzie swoje szczęście i radość na ziemii pokrytej piaskiem?

Karakara to krótka, pełna ciepła i spokoju historia, której jednak nie brakuje poważniejszych wątków. Świat wstaje po ogromnej katastrofie, a ilość postaci, którą zobaczymy w historii doskonale odzwierciedla to, jak bardzo odludnionym miejscem jest Sagami Francisco. Bohaterowie nie spodziewają się tego, że ich codzienna rutyna ulegnie zmianie, gdy na swej drodze spotkają czerwonowłosą dziewczynę, Aisię.

Po przeczytaniu całości można odnieść wrażenie, że historia jest jedynie wstępem do czegoś większego. I tak jest właśnie w tym przypadku. Debiut studia Calme już doczekał się kontynuacji i nie jest to nic dziwnego, ponieważ można zauważyć wyraźny trend w dzieleniu Visual Novel na mniejsze części. Karakara jest kinetyczną novelką, co oznacza, że nie będziemy mieli możliwości dokonywania żadnych wyborów.

Utwory są spokojne, wpadające w ucho, jednak nie wybijające się specjalnie na tle innych. Autorem rysunków postaci jest p19, który swoim delikatnym, kolorowym stylem doskonale oddał klimat panujący w historii. Opowieść polecam każdemu fanu okruchów życia i spokojnych, ciepłych historii.

评分9/10：这可能是你在steam上能玩到的最好的几个独立制作的gal！
制作方的名字叫calme，意思是平静的，在这个作品确实会让人感到平静呢。
1、剧情方面，基本上没有可黑的地方。并不无聊的日常，出色的伏笔以及比较完整的世界观，代入感很深，不仅能体会到角色的魅力，也能感受到他们的成长。
2、BGM上，有着十分不错的协调性，让人更能调动感情。切换的时候略有僵硬，期待下一作能更好。
3、良心的CG数量，以及不错的质量，作画是相当不错的，画风也很萌！槽点在于作者的侧脸和眼间距十分蛋疼，乍一看没啥问题仔细看还是感觉崩。。。正侧脸无法直视，人体小崩不过还说的过去emmmmmm上色很好看，整体十分好，背景也很用心。
4、翻译有点出戏，但不影响观看，句子也挺优美。
5、舒服的UI，设定也比较全，优化也没问题，满分。
6、如果你想社保，我只能说并不是很好用。画风不是很色气，而且这温馨的剧情直接让我进入了贤者时间，估计不打补丁会体验更好。

I'm not someone who plays visual novels, this would be my second try at one and well...

36594520.review:
[h1][i]“Youth always tries to fill the void, an old man learns to live with it.”[/i]
- Mark Z. Danielewski[/h1]

Finito KARAKARA, sono rimasto un po' perplesso su diverse cose, in primis se fosse una buona Kinetic Visual Novel o meno.
Ma andiamo con ordine.

In un mondo ambientato dopo una "Catastrofe", la popolazione umana è stata decimata e per cercare di salvare la razza umana, si è ricorso alla genetica dando vita così agli "Ibridi" o gli "Others", esseri umani con caratteristiche animalesche come orecchie e coda. Nelle vicinanze di una città, Sagami Francisco, chiamata così perché nata dall'unione di due culture, quella americana e giapponese, vive una coppietta, Leon e Lucia. I due giovani gestiscono un piccolo ristorante con consegne a domicilio. Tutto sembra andare normale finché un giorno i due non si imbattono in Aisia, una giovane ragazza sperduta in mezzo al deserto.

Mi fermo qui per non spoilerare troppo, ma non aspettatevi grandi colpi di scena o una trama seria. Si tratta di una storia semplice e passionale, che narra la vita di questi 3 giovani, soli in una terra arida che si fanno compagnia a vicenda. Particolare cura è stata data all'ambientazione, più volte il gioco spiegherà quello che è successo al mondo e di come la vita sia cambiata. 

Inoltre il comparto tecnico è molto curato. La grafica, infatti, è gradevole e ben fatta, e anche se i disegni non sono animati come in Nekopara (per citarne uno) comunque è stata prestata molta cura. Anche il comparto sonoro, le musiche e pure il doppiaggio del gioco (anche se riguarda solo le coprotagoniste mentre il protagonista, Leon non è doppiato), tutto è curato ai minimi dettagli e fatto bene.

Eppure direte voi, perché così perplesso? La storia innanzitutto, l'ho trovata semplice, forse un po' troppo semplice. L'ambientazione in effetti trae in inganno, che sembra dare l'impressione di avere a che fare con una Visual Novel con una trama notevole e interessante... E invece ci ritroviamo una trama dove narra perloppiù le vicende dei 3 ragazzi che convivono e con un pizzico di mistero intorno ad Aisia.

Tutto qua, veramente. Sono rimasto quindi mezzo deluso quando ho finito il gioco (dura 2-3 orette). Anche se ripeto, tutto quello che si vede e si sente è ben curato nei minimi dettagli (la trama per quanto semplice sia, è narrata veramente bene).

Infine KARAKARA presenta anche un content erotico che però è disponibile solo sul sito della Denpasoft a pagamento (eh sì avete letto bene). Tuttavia preciso che tutto ciò non è fondamentale ai fini della trama, in effetti le scene di sesso (molto passionali tra l'altro) sono un extra o un fanservice se lo vogliamo chiamare. Sinceramente questa opzione di mettere una patch 18+ a pagamento non mi è affatto piaciuta anche se quest'ultima si può trovare "altrove".

Quindi? Riassumendo, KARAKARA è una Kinetic Visual Novel semplice e ben curata, se avete 2-3 orette di tempo libero, giocatelo ma non fatevi illusioni, è una storia semplice e passionale non di più.

Voto: 6.5

36585720.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
KARAKARA is the first adult anime visual novel on Steam from developers, calme, published by Sekai Project.

KARAKARA (English: parched, dried up) introduces an interesting post-apocalyptic world, where the Earth's weather has become exceedingly hot and dry and most of the human population has perished, due to The Disaster: a remembered cataclysmic event with an unknown cause. In an effort to repopulate and strengthen humanity, most humans have been altered to include animal genes, and these extend through the breeding population. Four ears and a tail is now the norm.

The story focuses on a young man, Leon Laird; his long-term live-in friend, Lucia Haynes; their friend Cullen Lancaster; and a strange girl they find near the beginning of the game: Aisia Mayfield. Leon is a 'pure human', with no tail and only two ears, and the chef and owner of a small diner a short distance from the town of Sagami Francisco. Lucia is a cat girl who met Leon many years ago when his parents owned the diner; she works there and lives with him above the diner, but their relationship is purely platonic. Cullen is the local law enforcement agent and pre-Disaster researcher for the region.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
The game is presented in the standard visual novel style, with two-dimensional 'paper doll' anime characters positioned and occasionally animated in front of unmoving hand-drawn background pictures. Overlaid on the top is a simple interface with a large text box in which the story and dialog are displayed a sentence or two at a time, and a few control buttons.

The backgrounds are nicely drawn, though as is common for the genre they don't display any characters not central to the story -- which in this case means there are only four characters in the whole game. This is mildly more forgivable here with the desolate setting than in many other visual novels where the text describes a crowded scene, but the graphics show an empty one, but there are still a few scenes where a number of 'extras' off in the distance would have been appropriate. Character graphics are nicely drawn, with a style that personally I don't find quite as attractive as, say, Nekopara, but which is still very good. Animations are very limited, but there are a couple. The character art is by an artist with whom I'm unfamiliar: P19. A quick search on one of my favourite image boards showed art only relevant to KARAKARA.

The interface is minimal, as it should be in a visual novel in my opinion, with most of the functionality relegated to a series of option screens. It mostly works well, but I noticed a number of times that the text paused mid-sentence, requiring another click to advance it. I'm not sure what the hang up was here, but it happened at least a dozen or so times. There's also a dodgy-looking black effect that spins around in a circle to clear the screen; I think a simple fade to black would look much better.

Music is typical of anime visual novels; it could be from any one of the many that I've played over the years. It's well produced and sounds okay, and is exactly what you'd expect from this sort of game. Sound effects are very limited, but the game includes complete professional voiceovers in Japanese for all three female characters.

There's an animated cut scene for the opening credits, which is very well made. Interestingly, there's an unlockable music gallery as well as CG art gallery, which is a nice touch. The music doesn't appeal to me personally, but for anyone who likes it, this is a nice free alternative to paid soundtrack DLC.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
KARAKARA plays like any other game of the genre. The story is revealed a sentence or two at a time and you click the mouse button or press enter to advance to the next piece. Scene transitions happen automatically and the 'game' doesn't feature any interactivity beyond this; you can't influence the story at all as it unfolds.

On Steam, KARAKARA should really be tagged as a 'kinetic novel'; it has no choices, story branches, or any sort of gameplay beyond simply clicking to advance to the next piece of the story. It also should not be tagged with 'nudity' or 'sexual content', as it doesn't have these things unless you also purchase the adult patch from a separate store front. I'm not even sure that this patch is still available for purchase.

Initially I thought the game to be extremely derivative of Nekopara, though in a post-apocalyptic setting. As the story progressed that feeling faded, though, and indeed KARAKARA's story is interesting in its own right, with similarities to the Cat's Paradise realistically being no more than the protagonist working in the food industry and having a cat girl working for him.

As with any visual novel, the story and art are key to enjoyment of the title. As mentioned, KARAKARA's art is good, though not as good as some, and the story and characters are interesting and enjoyable. Though the script is rather silly and somewhat basic at times, the English version is well written and has obviously been edited by a professional with a good grasp of the written language. It's just a shame that not much actually happens.

Other than the game being incorrectly tagged on Steam, my biggest complaint is the length. I recently reinstalled it to play through again, in preparation for the sequel, and was disappointed to find that I read through the whole story in under two hours. For the price of the game -- especially once you add on the cost of the adult patch, if it's still available -- that's not very good value for money. The game's lack of interactivity and choice compounds this, making it a title that's really only appropriate for enthusiasts or those with money to spare.

[h1]Pros and Cons[/h1]
Pros:
+ Interesting setting
+ Excellent grammar
+ Pleasant art
+ Steam Achievements and Trading Cards

Cons:
- Expensive adult patch, which may no longer be available
- Far too short

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
KARAKARA is a competent 'kinetic' visual novel, with an interesting story, pleasant art, and likeable characters. The Steam version is not quite what you'd expect from the Steam store page, though, and it's far too short for the price. Wait for a deep discount or another bundle if you're interested.

A
S

Q
R

36462949.review:
emmmm，。、摘取一段印象很深的背景介绍

过去曾经发生过对人类而言的巨大不幸——【灾厄】

某个地方发生了致命的内战
某个城市发生了大规模的恐怖攻击

某个国家蔓延着药石罔效的疾病
某个地区爆发了国家之间的战争

回过神时、人类已经失去了八成左右的人口
漫长的生命危机让人类几乎丧失了生殖能力

濒临绝种的人类开始向其他生物寻求一线生机

某些人藉由长出猫的耳朵跟尾巴来留下众多的后代
某些人藉由导入狗的基因来获得多胎能力
某些人藉由让彼此的身体进行循环来提高免疫力

可是、即使用上了那些对策、人类还是没有停止衰退
原因是原生人类之间的斗争以及迫害
为了阻止衰退而开始的尝试只是让那些斗争死灰复燃而已

存在着众多非人之物——被称为【异人】的混种生物时代
被称为【黄昏的时代】的人类衰退期

以上是本游戏的背景大致介绍，emmm，，，一本正经的讲着人类生殖出现问题于是各种杂交开始了，。、，。、
你想要拯救末路的兽耳娘么？
你喜欢兽耳巨乳萌萝的女主么？
你想一本正经的边推边轻松生活么？
你想听着欢快的曲子干着龌龊的事情么？
如果想那么别犹豫买买买吧！（捂眼，。、抱歉我编不下去了，把我抬走吧，。、

36040722.review:
[u][Steam Version Review] (Without r18 Patch)[/u]
[b]KARAKARA[/b] is a short Visual Novel that has an excellent art design, well-coordinated pacing, fantastic soundtrack and a very intriguing plot. [b]This VN is simply beautiful.[/b] Unfortunately while it does exceed in having what an Top VN should have, it lacks in what any VN should possess to even be called a good VN. A good story from start to end. Although the "hook" is there from chapter 1 and chapter 2 seems to be taking the story in a more interesting direction, it ended abruptly like it's saying [i]"Well that's that. and we lived happily ever after".[/i]

No doubt [b]KARAKARA[/b] have some interesting characters and they never felt dull. But the story was establishing something bigger than itself. There is no Choices or options for you concern yourself on as [b]KARAKARA[/b] [u]is a Book in VN form.[/u] Overall I recommend this to everyone even if the story went nowhere. [b]KARAKARA[/b] is still a very well designed Visual Novel OMG that art.
Chapter 1(Very Good) Chapter 2(Meh)
[h1]10/10 [strike]would[/strike]Should buy this when it's ON SALE[/h1]

36025879.review:
Actually I had not much idea what should I expected from such game since it is my first visual novel. 

First of all, I must say this game is beautifully drawn. Characters and backgrounds are made perfectly.
Music is great, light and calm. Voice acting is not bad either, though the main character (you) does not have a voice at all - but you speak with others.

Unfortunately the above do not mean much without a story. The story of Karakara is divided into 2 chapters. The first chapter is boring. The second chapter is boring and stupid. There are no choices, you just go straight through a text. There is no action, everything goes awfully long. Main characters are plain and at some points way too irrational for me. 

Since visual novels are mostly a story then... well, some people here would say you don't play such games for the story but for other purposes. I know, but then I would take something more obvious like Sakura. Karakara looked more solid. 

I have a very mixed feelings about this game, even though graphically and musically Karakara is perfect. In the end I feel a bit more negative than positive about this production.
If you just want too look at cute anime girls, then this one will work for you. If you look for some more than that, then I am sorry.

35772560.review: In a world where cat and dog ears/tails are a thing, you take the role of the young Leon who struggle to keep the ends meet in his small restaurant. The visual novel features two anime-style episodes, filled with excitement, gorgeous art and some nudity content. Promises to keep you entertained for about 5-6 hours. There is a option to display Japanese alongside English, so you can learn new language if that is your thing. The game however does not feature any choices and ergo does not offer different endings. The main character had a few lines that felt annoying and out of place. Yet, it is a solid title created with much effort that I enjoyed, and would recommend to fellow visual novel gamers.

35176112.review: If a game is being published by Sekai Project, I will always give it a shot. I have yet to find anything from them that I didn't enjoy. I really liked Karakara and would recommend it to anyone who is a fan of these types of visual novels. The story was interesting, the characters were loveable and the world itself was so intriguing that I can't wait to explore it further in Karakara 2. Now that being said, this is very short (finished in about 3 hours) but it's warm and sweet. This isn't an epic like World End Economica or what have you - Karakara is light, simple and happy. This game also doesn't rely on nudity or x-rated scenes but focuses more on the characters. This is something I prefer as there have been a few games I've played in this genre that could have been waaay better if there wasn't such a heavy focus on trying to oversexualise certain parts of the story.

35159074.review:
Una visual novel que mezcla muchos generos. Su genero principal son hechos de la vida, meclado con fantasia, drama, romance y un pizca de hentai :333.

Muy buena visual novel, divertida. emocionante y sobre todos las chicas; mi favorita es la loli pechugona Lucia que me encanto desde el primer momento.

Lo unico malo es que la historia es algo lenta y que es muy corta. pues siento que le falto algo mas. pero como vendra secuela. esperemos que nos den mas de lo que ofrecieron; otro punto muy negativo, pero que tiene todas las visual novels es que NO este disponible en español, una pena que siempre a los Hispanohablantes nos deja de lado y luego se queja de la pirateria.

Este juego se lleva un 6/10. buena visual novel, recomendado para gente que le gusta el genero. Darle Gracias al Usuario Seven por ayudarme con la traducion del juego.

34588275.review:
Rating: 7/10 ("Good")

Recommended for: People who enjoy VNs, people who enjoy slice of life. Play this if you liked the Nekopara series. I would recommend this to a first time VN reader.

KARAKARA is a short visual novel with approximately 3 hours' reading time. There are no choices to make. The developers are called "calme", and that fits perfectly with this VN -- it is a very calming, relaxing, and enjoyable read.

It is set some time in the distant future, where "normal" humans are mainly gone from the picture, replaced instead with people that possess four ears, and, occasionally, a tail. The premise does require to suspend your disbelief, admittedly, but it's a little more believable than Nekopara's "catgirls are a subservient race" shtick.

The artwork is very pretty and of high quality. Each important character -- Aisia, Cullen, and Lucia -- have different expressions and poses depending on the context and even throughout a single line of speech. The CGs are also very nice, though the characters can occasionally look a little odd due to anatomy.

The soundtrack is very calming and was a fitting accompaniment to the visual novel. It never felt annoying or out of place.

KARAKARA's plot is mostly character-driven; we watch the characters interact and move the story forward. The characters themselves are all very likable. The main character you play as, Leon, is actually very likable as a lead. He doesn't come across as overly incompetent or brutish -- he's just a nice guy. Cullen, Lucia, and Aisia are all very distinct from one another and fun to read about. One of them was even a little surprising.

Overall, KARAKARA is a sweet slice of life novel, and I'll be looking forward to the  sequel. However, given its short reading time, I would recommend getting it on sale as opposed to at full price.

34095689.review:
通关撒花：KARAKARA，一款以兽耳娘为主角的视觉小说游戏，据说有R18补丁。最早是从朋友的共享库里玩到的，赶上进包顺便补票，具体剧情不太记得了，虽然原本就没什么剧情，应该是男主和几名兽耳娘没羞没臊的生活日常就对了。

背景设定是末世里，部分人类植入了兽类的基因，这样一来，兽耳娘的存在也就显得正常了。走在路上捡到的美少女，迅速成为家里的一员什么的，是不是很天方夜谭？嘛，这毕竟只是个游戏，细节就不要在意那么多了。总之，男主的后宫组建的相当有效率。

游戏流程比较短，没什么实质的内容，不打R18补丁就是个比较无聊的小白剧本，打了R18补丁以后，估计也没人在意剧情讲的到底是什么了。画风比较养眼，女主们都很萌，最近类似的游戏出的还蛮多的，假如游戏做的实在不行，还有卡牌背景来救场。

大概就是这个样子的了，尴尬无比的写完整篇评测的菲菲如是说。

《KARAKARA》第一次看见是因为画风和有出中文的希望而关注，然后就看见hb有大包出了就毫不犹豫的买了。
  作为和‘艹猫’一个类别的游戏本来是并不想多说什么的，流程很短，但个人感觉剧情比艹猫好。末世的背景，看似比较大的世界观，却讲诉日常的设定，反差比较大。

  对于人设，画风之类的，我是非常喜欢的，真的超赞，因为正好戳中了我的三个萌点“白丝” “萝莉” “兽耳娘”，所以这真的是福音（蓝毛超可爱）。

  今年好像会出第二作，希望流程长一些，剧情充实一些，希望变为剧情向（我就是那种就算是FPS游戏也主要看剧情的那种，若是纯黄油我反倒没兴趣），这样贵一点也无所谓啦。

  不管怎么说，我是十分推荐购买的。

Game: KARAKARA
Genre: Visual Novel
Developer/Publisher: calme/Sekai Project
System: Steam (PC)
Total Score: 80/100
Value Score: 8/10

• Story: 8/10
• Characters: 8/10
• GamePlay: 8/10
• Graphics: 10/10
• Sound: 10/10
• Music: 8/10
• Length: 4/10
• Replay Value: 5/10
• Player Value: 9/10

[u]Pros[/u]
+Great Voice Acting and a lot of VA work
+Great animations and backgrounds
+Decent OST
+A lot of setting options most of which involve voice settings for each individual character, you can lower their voice or raise their voice during scenes
+English, Chinese and Japanese language support for text
+Gallery mode which has CGs, music and videos (OP and ED)

[u]Cons[/u]
-Only Japanese voices in the voice acting
-Kinetic visual novel (only one ending/route)

33747449.review:
[h1]Safadas![/h1]

Eu não sou fã de jogos deste estilo, mas... Ok. O jogo [b]é censurado[/b], então, se vai comprar esperando ver peitos loucamente por aqui, esqueça. Isso eu já imaginava, porém, você pode adquirir um patch +18, comprando ou baixando pela internet. Por conta da censura, o jogo teve umas quebras loucas nos diálogos e 90% das "safadezas" nessa versão Steam são passadas por meio deles... Logo, se você não entender japonês ou inglês, você não entenderá nada e o jogo só será aproveitado para tu por meio de imagens, o que na real é bem pouco e fraco os momentos de "safadezas". Geralmente, compram jogos deste estilo por conta disso, mas lembre-se de que a Steam censura... Agora, se você realmente gosta desse estilo de jogo e ainda mais pela história, bem, devo dizer que ela é fraca. Não vi nada demais e acabou de forma bem tosca, pra piorar. Portanto, não acho que R$ 19,99 seja um valor correto para esse jogo. Apesar de eu ter ganho o jogo pela [url=https://www.steamgifts.com/]Steam Gifts[/url] através do sorteio de um amigo [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198211523380]safadão[/url], não vejo nada demais no conteúdo para cobrarem R$ 19,99. Talvez em 50% off ou mais seja algo a se pensar, porém depende muito qual será o seu objetivo com o jogo. Lembre-se da censura.

Caso você compre ou baixe o patch +18 e instale em seu jogo Steam, lembre-se: [b]NÃO POSTE SS COM CONTEÚDO +18 COM A PRIVACIDADE PÚBLICA.[/b] Você provavelmente correrá o risco de tomar um ban de 24h ou mais por conta disso. SS com conteúdo da versão Steam, não há problemas. Você dropará 3 cartas Steam e seus valores são sempre válidos à venda, o que podem ser conferidos pelo [url=http://steamcommunity.com/market/search?q=KARAKARA]mercado[/url].

[b]"Nossa, você mal falou sobre o jogo![/b]" - Não tem o que ficar falando. O terminei em menos de 2h e ainda li os diálogos. É curto, acredite. E nem é um estilo de jogo que eu realmente goste. A platina do jogo é fácil. Bem fácil.

Enfim, [b]KARAKARA[/b] só é recomendado em seu preço full para quem realmente gosta do estilo de jogo, sabe que não tem safadezas extremas e entenderá a história, isto é, sabe inglês e/ou japonês, podendo ainda esperar por um desconto de 33% off. Caso não entenda inglês e japonês e queira jogá-lo apenas pensando em safadezas, sinto muito: mal tem e os momentos que têm, são mais em diálogos, então se não souber as linguagens do jogo, vai entender nada. Tipo uma parte do rabo, hehe. Você só terá essa putaria toda fora da Steam, no patch que citei várias vezes na review. Podendo jogar o patch na versão Steam, porém sabendo o que postar à comunidade e ainda privando, para evitar ban.

Bom jogo! ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

ポストアポカリプスな世界観だが暗い雰囲気はほとんどなく、
3人の緩い日常生活と、ちょっとした事件を経て強まっていく3人の絆が話の中心のハートフルストーリー。

個人的にはこういう「滅びを迎える世界での静かな日常生活モノ」が大好きなので、
（ゲームでいうとアーシャのアトリエやeden*、小説でいうと終末のフール等）
この雰囲気はドストライクでした。
何より、ヒロインが可愛い。めちゃくちゃ可愛い。

続編も製作中らしいので楽しみです。

33555613.review:
Okay, ja.... Den Patch hätte ich mir sparen sollen
Wie das bei vielen Visual Novels auf Steam üblich ist, gibt es auch für dieses einen R18-Patch. Leider. Ich instaliere sie immer, da ich es nicht einsehe, nicht alles von einem produkt zu haben, für das ich bezahlt habe.Aber fangen wir von Vorne an.
Karakara ist ein Post-Apokalyptisches (Erwartet nicht zu viel. Man brauchte nur einen Grund für Ohren) Visual Novel ohne Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten. Die Story erreicht auf meiner Skala die "Ganz Nett"-Marke, der Artstyle weiß zu gefallen, kommt natürlich aber nicht an einen Animationsgrad a la Nekopara heran. Die Welt und ihre Gegebenheiten muss man zu großen Teilen zwischen den Zeilen lesen und was genau die "Apokalypse" ausgelöst hat, wird nie ganz geklärt. Es geht eigentlich nur um die zwischenmenschliche (Otherisch? WIe heißt das bei den "Others"?) Beziehung der drei Protagonisten. 
Bis hierhin, ganz gut. Einen Sale-Preis wert.
Nun zum Patch. Er wirkt komplett hineingeschustert (Szenen NACH den Credits) und hebt sämtliche "Ganz Netten" Plot-Twists auf ein vollkommen Hanebüchenes Level. Ich will nicht zu viel verraten, aber "Ich bin neu bei euch. Jetzt sage ich, das wir alle in einem bett schlafen sollten. Außerdem solltet ihr beide es miteinander treiben, ich schau so lange zu." Und das ist noch harmlos. Ehrlich, spart euch, den Patch zu lesen, lasst ihn von mir aus für die Achivements (Für den man ihn leider braucht) durchlaufen (skipping Mode). Nur dann ist die Story nicht vollkommen bescheuert.
Trotzdem eine EMpfehlung, denn die reine Steam-Version hat ihn ja nicht.

首先 ，先说说这款游戏的缺点。1.剧情太短了，仅仅只有两章，诚意还是不够的。2.有些地方的剧情还是有些迷，玩过二周目能发现很多的迷，只能靠自己的脑补来解决。3.pv字幕是否可以根据所选语言播放呢？
之后再说说她的优点，1.画风实在是很萌啊，让我喜欢上p19大大并且萌上兽耳娘了呢。2.音乐仔细听还是可以的（大概吧），特别是剧情结束后回到主界面时慢节奏的音乐让我倍感失落，十分期待下一部，这可能也是这部作品的成功之处吧3.R18内容很可以啊hiahiahia，整部作品仿佛在对我说：别想给你的鸡儿放假233333。4.设定挺新颖的，这是在一个人类几近灭亡的时代，人们尝试转基因来改变性状，例如高产啊之类的来给人类续命。5.剧情前后铺垫，虽然这些铺垫很简单，第一周目就可以猜出来很多剧情，比较死，但是毕竟剧情短嘛，没长度来做一些大的铺垫来让人大吃一惊。
但是，综合而言（如果能除去剧情短这个毛病）这将会是一部不可多得的神作。另外，我十分期待第二部啊2333，听说快要出来了挺开心的，现在就期待不要又是短剧情。

33369448.review:
本人的不专业见解，还请见谅
[h1]前言[/h1]
我是在sekai project的humble bundle大包入的这款游戏。游戏由calme开发，sekai project代理发行的一款视觉小说，标题《KARAKARA》是日语里面“干旱”的发音。游戏故事发生在后启示录时代，为数不多的人类与混合人种的故事。故事背景虽然庞大悲凉，但是游戏本身是个十足的萌豚游戏，支持繁中。下一作KARAKARA2也即将发布发售日期，希望可以将更多故事讲完。
[h1]女主角们与男主的羞羞生活[/h1]
剧情总体来看和《巧克力与香子兰》类似，讲述了男主和两只兽耳妹子经营餐厅的故事。经典的萌豚剧情，很白开水，属于那种看了就忘的一种。剧情有些短，就做了两章的内容，男女主角云雨（我是打过补丁的）的剧情也来得相当快，总觉得少了些什么。Steam版也做了相应的阉割，需要补丁的朋友到其他评论区里找，这里就不做搬运了。
[h1]萌豚喜爱的萌萌哒的兽耳妹子[/h1]
女主们的人设倾向于幼女化（虽然那里那么大），都带有萌萌的兽耳，很明显就能看出作者的癖好（经搜索，画师P19是专业的兽耳画师，作品有：《しろのぴかぴかお星さま》《姫狐の召使い》《ひまわり!! -あなただけを见つめてる》等），也迎合了某些特定族群的喜好。作画风格还是比较精良的，但是没有像《巧克力与香子兰》一样使用E-mote系统，人物只是静态立绘，战斗场景表现力差的比较多。有人物配音，配得不错。
[h1]轻巧愉快的BGM[/h1]
游戏的BGM还算可以，整体活泼向上，烘托场景都很到位。可惜没有OST卖，这里搬运一下别人的b站ost  https://www.bilibili.com/video/av11153163/
[h1]总览[/h1]
优点：
1.萌妹子人设
2.好听的BGM
3.支援繁中


缺点：
1.剧情过短，有点突兀，单薄，没有选项
2.不支持云存档


一款经典的萌豚游戏，人设是兽耳幼女，主要针对于特定族群。流程很短，连打补丁也挽救不了单薄的剧情，但是你是怀着社保的心来玩，那恭喜，它是你的菜。在当前价位上整体不如《巧克力与香子兰》，个人建议入包买。背景还可以，拿来合卡是不错的。就看下一部了，希望剧情能改善一下。steam没有相应的打分机制，我的印象分是7/10，还算给个推荐吧。

33301950.review: 大切的朋友送我的，对！就是往大了那么切的朋友，一块一块的。玩完了以后我的感想是。我想把女主当妹妹养，把女二当闺女养，我想把女警当老婆养。这怎么办？男主太次，说上就上，然后该上不上。没有得到诚哥的真传。女性：“请你像我这样做”诚哥：“我就像你这样做”寂寞了，只要找我，我二话不说就是干，来几个干几个。果然还是诚哥最好（诚哥脸）。剧情？是说当世界由于大规模的核战争而遭到毁灭性的打击后，人类为了争夺仅有的淡水和食物、、、、、、我在说什么啊？？？这游戏里没有北斗神拳，也没有血与泪的故事，虽然包含血和泪吧。但是真的，真的没有那么复杂的世界观。看到有人说会出二代我也是放心了，最起码会把这个故事讲完。除了男主和3个女性角色外，这故事也没有任何其他活人了，导致我也看不懂，到底是向谁保密？吸血鬼的秘密。一直说：“有人不会这么想”人在哪？游戏里一直没刻画这么一个隐约知道内情的角色，我一直期待男主和一帮要杀了吸血鬼的村民闹事或者和女二命运中的宿敌相遇，结果和女警擦出什么火花，结果并没有，感觉不需要男主，改成百合我还能爱一点，虽然我不建议购买，但是如果出了二代的话，打折的情况下可以试一试。另外，改成好多路人角色的游戏也不错的感觉，本来大家都不知道而且都害怕吸血鬼，但是命运在一家世纪末的食堂交织在一起，发生了很多很小却很感动的故事。得知了真相的某个组织因为得到了消息，要铲除异类，最后和其他人一起保护少女的发展感觉也不错。

33068495.review:
让我们在这贫瘠之地上活下去吧。
故事背景是“黄昏时代”——一个灾难之后的世界。“异人”和人类共同生活在这一块贫瘠之地上。大大小小的故事将在这个不到2000人口的小镇上发生。
虽然炎热，但他们互相依托，虽然空虚，但他们互相补足。

这是一个没有选择项目的GalGame，游戏过程也是很短的，普通的话大概1个多小时就能通关。但由于自己和主人公有点相似（外貌和性格），我硬是玩了4个小时通关，把自己代入进了角色。

人物性格和剧情塑造了一个个非常动人的故事，但是感觉有点虎头蛇尾。人设看上去是非常不错的，我也是第一眼就萌上了Lucia，不过一开始的配音的确没能接受，还好是日久♂生情了，加上插画和背景，略显一般吧。世界观倒是很让我入迷，毕竟都给啪啪啪这种事一个理由了。总体还是一款不错的游戏，但是设定和人物背景上的一些坑要在续作上补吗。

Emmm，客观评价的话，我觉得 7/10这样吧。还是可以入的，HB包血赚，补丁在贴吧上搜搜可以找到。

33022930.review:
Honestly If I could I’d give it a mixed or neutral rating but since I have no choice I’ll go with not recommended.

So the story seems like it could’ve been more interesting, they mention that some sort of disaster had befallen humanity and now years later they are still struggling from the outcome…and if it weren’t because they mention this mysterious disaster you wouldn’t even know something bad had happened…I mean seriously, a good looking shop…dude owns a car…they have a rather nice home…electricity… beautiful clothes…everything essencial to live and more...a puppy…yeah ok.

Basically the protagonist’s biggest struggle was not the apocalypse but that the shop was understaffed and after finding the cute pink haired hobo on the side of the road that fixed itself. Actually the worst thing to happen to our dear protagonist Leon was when [spoiler]he was forced to decide which of the girls has the biggest tiddies.[/spoiler] Every time some sort of problem arises it immediately gets resolved since it wasn’t even a problem to begin with just a silly misunderstanding.

The characters are stagnant, having the same personality and thoughts all through the short little story. It was very cute yes but it just got rather dull very quickly. You can finish it in about 2 hours or a little less, the only reason I have 5hrs clocked in is because I idled for cards.

The music is pretty good although repetitive, the art is quite nice, and the voice acing isn’t bad.

If you want the R-18 scenes keep in mind steam has the censored version. Since I haven’t gotten the patch I can’t comment on whether that is worth it or if it's also dull. Due to being censored some scenes end rather quickly and randomly since you know all the action was supposed to happen afterwards.

So I guess it’s not a horrible kinetic novel but it just wasn’t completely to my liking.

32948458.review:
GLANCE RECOMMENDATION: [u][b]94% YES[/b][/u] / 6% NO

[h1]GOOD[/h1]
[list]
[*]Stellar visuals and gorgeous character designs. Very reminiscent of Clannad but if most of the characters were dog or cat people.
[*]Story is simple and heart warming. Watch as the dialogue carries you through a dying land and the diner that struggles to find purpose. It's a bleak setting with two great wholesome characters to engage the main character, making it a bittersweet engagement. There is an odd spot in the story concerning revelations and previous scenes, but it's so minor in the grand scheme of the game.
[*]Oddly calming music that has, at times, reminded me of a few Persona 3 tracks.
[/list]

[b]Special Note On Pricing[/b]
Please note that, like a few Sekai Project games, this is a censored version that removed the H-scenes. DenpaSoft does offer the R18 DLC, so consider that if you like this project and want to see all of the scenes. If you're worried that the patch costs $10, consider that the Steam version costs $10 which would total $20 at full price for everything, compared to the true full price of the game outside of Steam which is $20 so really you're paying the same price. In fact you'll probably get a discount on Steam or even dirt cheap through Humble Bundle, so the total cost is going to be rather low compared to the full price on the site. I only write all this out because I find the patch worth the work and urge everyone to purchase the patch if you're curious.

[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
I want to see more of Karakara. I loved the characters, the setting, the dialogue, and the art. It's a short romp, but consider this even at the full price. With the announcement of Karakara 2, I'll definitely have something to look forward to.

「有著一個很有趣的世界觀，但劇情跑完後感覺才走完了共通線的一小部分」
評分: 8
劇情: 5/10
音樂: 8/10
人設: 10/10
CV:   10/10
遊戲性:電子小說不評分

評語:就像是吃了一道軟綿綿的甜點，吃了幾口想繼續吃下去時就已經結束了，畫風、音樂與CV非常的和我胃口，從價格上來說真的是物超所值，雖然應該有蠻多人是衝著有補丁才購買的，但我想說，就算沒有補丁也不失為一個好的小品遊戲，當你想要放鬆一下時會是個很好的選擇。

遊戲的缺點淺而易見，應該是有著經費的考量，在劇情上面並沒有做過多的琢磨，但也留了可以繼續寫下去的設定，另外在CV的選用上還是有點微微的建議，かわしまりの的聲線與以往的作品表現來說還是比較適合配同年紀的青梅竹馬或大一年級的學姐，配蘿莉音感覺還是太勉強啦。

總之，如果想要吃一個如同甜點般的遊戲，推薦試試KARAKARA

32688844.review:
카라카라

일본 아니메 그래픽의 비주얼 노벨.
이런 종류의 게임은 처음 해보는 거라
게임 자체보다도 일단 장르에 대해 할말이 있음.

첫 번째로, 이걸 게임이라고 생각할수 있나?
이 '게임'의 경우는 선택지도 없고,
그냥 계속 다음으로 넘어가면서 진행함.
솔직히 이건 최소한의 그림과 애니메이션이 들어간 오디오북임.
나는 흔히 '연애 시뮬레이터'라는 장르를 별로 좋아하지 않는데,
지루해 뒤질거 같음. 차라리 만화를 보지.
많이 안해봐서 잘 모르겠지만, 말그대로 선택지만 있는 게임은 
게임이라고 인정할 수 없을 것 같음.

두 번째로는, 게임 참 쉽게 만듦.
위에서 쓴대로 캐릭터가 띄워져서 말만하는 '연애 시뮬레이터'의 경우는(이 게임도 마찬가지고)
사실상 '게임 플레이'라는 게 없기 때문.
그리고 이거는 내 편견이긴 한데,
이쁜 캐릭터를 집어넣은 게임은 시스템 대충 만들고 재미를 없애버림.
요즘 모바일 게임에 많음.

뭐 이 '게임'에 대해 말해보면,
왠지 남자성우는 없고 여자성우만 있음.
(어짜피 여자들은 이 게임을 안 할 테니까 돈 아낄라고 그런가.)
일본어를 할 수 없는 나는 한글 패치가 없으니 영자막으로 플레이 할 수 밖에 없는데,
영자막을 읽으며 일본어 목소리를 듣는 것이 매우 혼란스러움.
그리고 내가 조작 할 수 있는 것이 없으므로 
평가할 수 있는 요소는 스토리 밖에 없을 것 같음.
.. 그렇지만 아까 말했듯이 지루해 뒤질거 같음.
나는 게임하러 왔지 책 읽으러 온게 아님.
어쨌든 만화 비스무리한 책 읽는 기분으로 플레이함.

일단 최대한 텍스트를 다 읽어보려고 노력함.
스토리의 장르는 판타지, 에로고 중심 내용은 일상 + 청순인 듯.
스토리 배경은 졸라 얼척없음.
왜 이런 짧은 플롯에 장엄하고 어이없는 백스토리가 필요함?
캐릭터가 행동하는 것들도 앞뒤 개연성이 떨어지고,
계속 '대체 왜?' 하고 묻게 됨.
또 플롯의 위기나 중심 사건의 깊이가 매우 얕아서
스토리 흐름이 정말 노잼스럽게 느껴졌음.
거기다가 이런 일련의 사건들은 정말 진부했음.
뭐 그래도 개인적으로는 엄청 극혐이다 수준이진 않았음.

솔직히 이 '게임'을 하는 목적이 개연성 찾고 스토리 분석하는건 아니잖슴?
이 '게임'을 즐기는 요소는 결국 플롯과 보이스(?)와 CG...인 것 같고,
그 요소들은 충분히 그 역할을 수행하고 있다고 생각함.
물론 맘에 안 드는것들이 '졸라게' 많지만,
만화 읽는 느낌으로 생각없이 플레이하면 할만한 듯.
참고로 19금 버전은 dlc 패치로 따로 팜.(스팀에 없음.)

추천

진행도: 엔딩 봄.
도전과제 다 깸.

32648125.review:
Deutsch/English

Als absoluter Neuling in Sachen Visual Novel habe ich noch keine Vergleichsbasis(Bin von VA-11 Hall-A auf VNs gekommen, aber mir war sofort klar, dass damit die wenigstens Spiele jemals gemacht Schritthalten können), aber alles in allem kann ich sagen, dass KARAKARA mir gefallen hat, nur würde ich es nie für 10$ oder auch nur die Hälfte kaufen.
Beim betrachten der anderen Reviews ist auffällig, wie sehr sich Spieler von Visual Novels doch von vielen anderen Genres unterscheiden, sämtliche, die ich gelesen habe sind sehr fundiert und oft auch umfassend (Anstatt Sachen wie "Totaler Scheiß" oder "Best Game ever").
Deshalb kann ich sagen, dass man sich die oberen durchlesen sollte (Ob schlecht oder gut) und sich daraus seine Quintessenz ziehen kann. Ja, es ist hübsch gemacht, ja die Musik ist gut und dennoch weist die Story und das Charakterdevelopment starke schwächen auf, zeitwillig echt "überzuckert".
Was den Diskurs um den Content ohne Jugendfreigabe angeht: Klar ist das totaler Scheiß von den Entwicklern, aber wenn ich Porn will dann gehe ich das nicht in meiner Steambibliothek suchen.

Ich habe das Spiel zusammen mit einem Duzend anderen im Humblebundle bekommen und bereue nichts.
PS: Achja, ich habe das Spiel in gemütlicher Geschwindigkeit in 2,8 stunden druchgelesen, wenn du also ein schneller Leser bist kannst du es dir holen, feritg spielen und wieder zurückgeben lassen. Wer nicht mal 3 stunden Spielspaß für einen Zehner versucht zu verkaufen hat nichts anderes verdient

Well, as an absolute Newbie when it comes to visual novels, i dont have that much experience, except VA-11 Hall-A, which hooked me on the whole thing. Because i knew, the very least number of games would be able to step up to this one, i was still enjoying KARAKARA, id just never buy it for the full price or even half of it.
Looking at the other Reviews here, its remarkeble, how different player of visual novels 
 are compared to those of other genres. The ones i read where well-thought and extensive (instead of things like "What a bullshit" or "Best game ever 10/10")
So i say, simply read the first here, no matter if they are positiv or negative, its just a matter of perspective and this way you can get your own.
Its a beautiful artwork, the music is nice, but the story and charakterdevelopment... its just too much sugar sometimes.
Last thing is the content for adults... Okay of course its a dick move from the developer, but do you seriously search your steam if you want porn? 

Got this game along with a dozen other in the humble bundle and i regret nothing.
Ps: It took me 2,8 hours to complete as a non-native english speaker, so you will probably be able to buy it, play it through and give it back. Someone who tries to sell close to 3 hours of fun for 10 buck, does not deserve better.

32529772.review:
KARAKARA is a sub-par VN that should be avoided. 

PROS: The graphics, audio, and text options are fairly fleshed out for a game as simple as this one. It can run at 60+ FPS and at least 1080p. 

CONS: The writing is simplistic. Plot tends to meander from one minor conflict to another, resolving each time almost immediately. There are very few characters, and the ones we see have little depth. Leon, the protagonist you play as, is inconsistent and aggravating (from the reader's perspective), going from timid to assertive and back in a matter of paragraphs. The art and music is generic and there is little of it. DLC that unlocks the 18+ content is $10 from Denpasoft.com at the time of this review. I ain't spending that much on virtual waifus. 

CONCLUSION: If you are new to visual novels, get something else on Steam, or better yet download Katawa Shoujo for free from their site. KARAKARA isn't worth your time or money.

32342890.review:
This is my first review for a game.

So I got this game off the Humble Bundle. Along with a few other games which I have yet to play, only paying $1 made it quite the steal. 

The game is okay. It's short as far as VN's go (2-3 hour playtime), it has a plain story and a few cute girls. I went in very lightheartedly and not expecting much at all, and that's what I got. The H scenes are fine. The MC is as generic as they come, and the moeblobs are rather cute, but the chemistry between the characters is a little weird. Lucia is a childhood friend and has spent a lot of time with MC-kun, and their first time actually doing anything sexual together it is initiated by Aisa, a character who has been in comparison been around for a few days. She gets Lucia in the mood, then lets the two of them do their business together. Then a few days later Leon does the same with Aisa, and I found it a little weird how Lucia is completely okay with them boning, telling each other how much they love each other, and showering each other with kisses. I was under the impression that Lucia and Leon had something going on a bit more personal but I digress.

Really I have no idea what else to talk about. It's rather devoid of any content that giving a review of it is harder than I expected now that I'm a few sentences in.

If you get the game from the HB, check it out. It won't harm you and you'll be finished with it over an evening. The $11 price tag on Steam is laughable for the miniscule amount of content you're getting. 

5/10 - does nothing special in any regards, but it did not egregiously offend me so I guess it has that going for it.

31582937.review:
[b]KARAKARA第二部将于2017年后半年发布哟~
所以还请安心的享受游戏吧！[/b]

[h1]日常的开始，日常的结束。未能完全展开的剧情[/h1]

剧情是温馨的日常，但是这个世界观却是非常沉重啊！人类完蛋了！！！！！[b]兽娘既正义！[/b]
剧情不像艹猫甜的发腻，口味调理的刚刚好。剧情一路也是风平浪静，前方无雷~剧情当中没有什么大的起起落落，仔细想来这文本长度也很难表现一两个大的起起落落。
而且角色们都这么萌，总是令人产生保护的欲望。所以说还是风平浪静的好啊~~再加上两人也是俩活宝，基本上笑着推完游戏。
游戏文本大概3-4小时就可以看完，缺乏很多细节，毕竟是小作坊作品。而且剧情在最后戛然而止，令我非常不爽...主要是一开始玩真没想到这么短。直到前不久我才得知第二部的消息。原来他们没有拿钱走人~

[strike]剧情真对不起CG和音乐的说.....
根本就没有正经剧情的说....[/strike]

[h1]倘若世界于夕阳之中逐渐落下帷幕，那就让我们放松心情，去欣赏着最后的风景吧[/h1]

steam的gal作品并不是非常丰富的。这款karakara虽然没有艹猫的动态立绘，但在CG上也是非常下功夫的。
本作的画师：P19，是一位擅长绘制巨乳萝莉的画师，萝莉身材、大眼睛小嘴巴的人物立绘十足的讨人怜爱，而肉感十足的细腻线条也是充分的诱惑了玩家。而且随剧情不断更换的人物表情也是十足的萌点！使得本作的三位女性角色成了这世界里一抹亮丽的风景，[strike]总想突破次元墙摸头[/strike]
在近几年的gal里这个画风是中上成了，只能说P19的立绘和cg独具特色，为游戏增色不少。
[spoiler]全是萝莉啊！充分满足了萝莉控们的需求[/spoiler]

[h1]终焉世界中爱的赞美诗[/h1]

本作的主题曲是曾经负责过[b]干物妹小埋、三者三叶[/b]以及IG社全部作品音乐的MANYO，他并不是专业的音乐学院出身，而是自学成才的一位作曲家。[spoiler]仰望dalao[/spoiler]
本作的音乐：大久保潤。曾经负责过：[b]艦娘海戦歌[/b]。而这次也没有让我们失望，游戏中的Bgm都可以使人驻足欣赏许久。
而声优们精彩的表演为这篇短篇游戏增加了含金量！两个主角也是两位名CV献声，分别是：
[b]Aisia的配音是田口宏子[/b],曾经为：春日野穹、周防天音、祠草時子等人物配音[spoiler]嗯，春日野穹[/spoiler]
[b]Lucia的配音是瑞泽溪曾经为[/b]：时坂紫，水上由岐，宇佐美春，八代让叶等人物配音[spoiler]八代让叶：想不到吧！我和紫妹是一个人！！！[/spoiler]

[h1]最后玩完感觉......
[b]倘若无聊的话，推推这个做工优良的gal，再来一杯好茶，可以帮助你度过一个愉快的午后[/b]
[strike]当然，你要是不在意这点钱的话.....[/strike]
[b]剧情略显单调而且没有什么内涵，CG才是本篇游戏的亮点，音乐上没有异常出彩的地方但是特别好听。[/b]
有卡就好了！！！！[/h1]

[h1]官网： [/h1] http://calmeworld.com/krkr/

31582280.review:
买了好一段时间了，空闲之余也发现有了繁中就点开来玩了，然后就。。。。

对于这款游戏来说时长确实不长，但是CG，BGM，CV个人感觉都是挺不错的，剧情上面也有点小出乎意料，但故事很温馨很温暖的说，个人还是挺喜欢看这样的幸福小故事的w。感觉对于大背景下的设定还有许多内容可讲（所以就决定出KARAKARA Vol.2是伐）。。两个Chapter的内容分别是两条主人公线的感情推进，我还是挺期待更多的发展的，毕竟个人觉得从各种设定上来说都挺有意思的[spoiler]（不过据说2会出新的角色）[/spoiler]。。

[spoiler]话说这种双飞结局真心大丈夫嘛。。明明在不可描述居然可以安心旁观的アイシア真心让我笑出声。。ルーシャ好可爱呀，好想摸摸耳朵呀。。qwq[/spoiler]

总结来说，作为一个温馨小故事挺适合在闲暇之余点开来看看，纯粹的小感动一定会给你在心里留下那么一点的痕迹的>w<

[h1][b]毕竟是尾巴长在前面的生物；还是免不了俗呀，咳咳(ง •_•)ง[/b][/h1]
[list]
如何获取完整版游戏：
    [*][KARAKARA]steam售卖为全年龄版；完整版需购买补丁；或购买完整版(实体版仅日本地区销售)[strike]官网有具体链接[/strike]
    [*]除steam外另有三家网上商店销售全年龄版、完整版、补丁(补丁价格约1000日元[9.99美元])
    [*]Dt不限制IP；日本的两家如果不是日本IP的话；可能会遭到海外IP限制。
    [*]购买的话日本网站购买是较为合算；信用卡充值购买有充值返利；而且算汇率也要稍便宜些。
    [*]目前KARA官方已更新中文；如补丁无中文在购买的网站重新下载一遍就行。
[/list]
[list]
游戏内容：
    [*]游戏总流程约2小时；共3章[strike](序章[无] 第一章[搞蓝色] 第二章[搞粉色])[/strike]
    [*]作为一个流程不长的小黄油视觉小说算较为合格，质量不错。
    [*]游戏设定在末日；人畜杂交幸存+男主开店+自带女主+路遇女二+日常+搞戏=KARAKARA
    [*]剧情整体上：背景存在感很弱只叙述故事合理性；主推日常，惯例出些事感情加深然后...
    [*]作为一款小黄油来看；剧情整体处理得不错；没有出现剧情和玩家都急不可耐想快进的大忌；流程不长但剧情前戏是做足的
    [*]作为一款全年龄视觉小说来看；剧情实在是没有什么可取之处；和艹猫一样没有剧情的剧情；只可当前戏不可当主菜
    [*]画风较为讨喜可爱清新；剧情画风各方面(包括补丁内容在内)受众偏大众；无猎奇重口味等成分
[/list]
[h1]【推荐】[/h1]
这款游戏整体上和艹猫统一类型水平；数字版+补丁原价也基本持平；总流程略少于艹猫，总价格也稍高；
R18剧情少于艹猫；如果考虑是在艹猫与KARA二选一的话；还是更倾向于艹猫；KARA与艹猫的剧情半斤八两[strike]【(σ｀д′)σ两个都买自然最好啦】[/strike]
不过这款游戏依旧是一款质量不错；价格亲民的游戏；[strike][艹天艹地艹空气；现在真是什么都能艹][/strike]
适合摄入不深的绅士玩家；毕竟涉入不深的话，这种虽无法与传统的剧情流程质量相比较，但传统的动辄好几百起价也不是一时半刻接受的。
毕竟是尾巴长在前面的生物；这篇说得俗气了一点见谅；[strike][这句话真是看一次想笑一次ฅʕ•̫͡•ʔฅ][/strike]

要说游戏比较大的缺陷就是：总流程稍短，当然这也不算太大的事情；
就是感觉少艹了一个东西；应该还有一个第三章[搞黄色]那只才对呀！
这感觉就像是唐僧师徒4人去西天取经；看着画面挺和谐；却发现少了一只白龙马的诡异感觉。
也许是经费不够；或者其他的种种原因，最后剧情就是少了一只白龙马；看着挺和谐；却有说不出的诡异。


[i]以上仅为个人观点；感谢您花费宝贵的时间阅读。[/i]

穷困潦倒的四月，揭不开锅的某人终于将目光放到了以前+1但并没有动过的游戏上面
是的。我打开了karakara。然后因为那过短的流程大大辜负了我消遣时间的期待，而陷入一种莫名的呆滞之中。
“花钱买的游戏为什么还要花时间玩”这句话某种程度上是有道理的，因为如果你不玩，就不会在玩了之后，开始质疑自己的钱花的值不值。
我给了karakara好评。但不代表这部作品大体没什么问题，相反它的问题很大。
在是否推荐这个问题上我选【是】。因为商店界面的立绘和cg就可以下定决心买下这款游戏的人看到这里就可以离开了。
我并不是在歧视你们这些“以萌为食的丧尸”，不如说我也是其中不可救药的一员。只是我接下去要说的东西，可能有些过于现实和尖刻了。
我花了远比玩游戏更久的时间，来思考说服自己这几十块钱花的很值。


首先是男主角的刻画，不单指karakara，延伸到所有恋爱文字冒险同类甚或不同类的游戏里，这部分都存在问题。
大部分的gal都有弱化男主个性，削减男主存在感的倾向，甚至通常扮演“毒蛇吐槽变态充满青春活力却无处发泄”的男主基友角色都比男主的戏份要多。这是可以理解的，不如说大家都选择性忽视了这一点，简直是串通好了一般自然地理解了这一点。这是从厂商方面对玩家游戏体验的考虑，从涉足此游戏类型开始都应该明白的隐形规则，那就是男主人公的代入感。[strike]男换成女也说得通[/strike]
不露脸、没有语音、甚至在[spoiler]hsence[/spoiler]cg中出现都没有辨识度，这就是gal男主人公。一行一行的文字滚动，剧情推进，一个又一个有魅力的女性角色登场，你会模糊【我】这个概念，幻想是自己在那个世界冒险。
一部gal想要让玩家满意，只要女性角色立绘过得去，cg做满诚意，接着就是做到男主存在感稀薄这一点，就一定会有人买账。
剧情是什么？剧情根本不重要。
买下这些作品的人根本不在乎所谓的男主跟女主女二三四有什么故事立下过什么誓言共同经历了什么考验，他们在乎的是欣赏cg中婉转求欢的女性角色时能把自己代入成那根[strike]肮脏的性器[/strike]的主人。
说的很难听，但事实如此。
因为说到底galgame的内核，就是异性与性。
明确了这一点，接着来谈谈“根本不重要的剧情”吧。

剧情在galgame中算是最难做的部分，并非技术层面，而是做出来的东西难以迎合需求。
这样问题就出现了，既然galgame只要有异性和性就够了，那为什么我们那么看重剧情呢？
不同人可能会给出不同的答案，不，是一定会给出符合自己理解的答案。
一部部去数太累了，我只能捡解读起来最简单的说。
——沙耶之歌只是一个恶劣的玩笑吗？那些畸形的怪物、腐烂的肉糜只是为了迎合某些玩家的性癖或说猎奇心理吗？
我觉得不是的。
那么腐姬也不是，那么恋狱月狂病也不是。
例子是举不完的，什么都好，在做gal的这群人，有一部分将重点放在异性与性之外的东西上。他们认为与【异性】【做爱】之前是要有类似润滑剂的东西的。所以两性交合的cg无关紧要，将目光放在人与人之间的交流联系上。他们非为迎合玩家，而是努力得到玩家理解。
他们努力的成果，我称之为爱情故事。

这之后虽然不可能在时间轴上做个标记，但分歧确确实实的存在着。只为欲望服务，彻头彻尾的拔作算其中的一个极端；然后，抛开爱情和性欲，自顾自讲故事的作品算其中的另一个极端。
拔作固然烂俗，但自己的职责尚有好好地在履行。而讲故事的galgame与其说另辟蹊径，不如说走入邪道了。
喔，这里的例子是素晴日。
素晴日是否是一部优秀的作品？
我给的答案是肯定的，不如说我相当喜欢。
但素晴日是否是一部合格的gal？
这个问题的答案值得商榷，我要说，尽管它有妹子，有h，[strike]有很多妹子，有很多h[/strike][spoiler]还有女装卓司[/spoiler]它一切的一切都想让你开口说它是一部合格的gal。
它不是。
走入邪道走到极致，也不过是avg而已。邪道就是邪道，再强也不是正道。
这意味着，不必黑深残，不必体会道理，不必回味无穷，男主和女主不必阴阳两隔，女配不必身首异处，不需要有什么黑幕有什么阴谋。
gal跑去做avg的反面典型，有一部叫梦或现实的连理结的作品。游玩时候的感想就是人设和立绘被糟蹋了，还有做不到就不要勉强一类恨铁不成钢的心情。玩下来心情很差，感觉剧情甚至不如里番。
回到最初我说的，gal就是异性与性。
想的简单想的穿一点，就是爱情故事。
包着gal外皮是做不好avg的，因为女孩在那里，爱情在那里，讲得再多路途再远，还是要回到正题。
说来惭愧，我以为秋之回忆那一类是最称职的gal。[spoiler]md然后kid就倒闭了[/spoiler]

将以上全部套进karakara里，你会发现我说的太大太空了，不适合这样流程三小时ctrl十分钟短小精悍的作品。
你问我为什么要对这样一部折入并不亏，大家都能开心的作品发这么大的火。
[spoiler]你问我我问谁[/spoiler]
是期待吗，还是空虚呢。
lion不是一个显眼的男主，没有辨识度的脸，没有辨识度的傻笑，没有辨识度的着装，除了没有理由的艳福毫无特色。
但这是一个实实在在的角色，是一个代入会产生障碍的个性男主。
karakara包着日常的外皮，实际上有一个很吓人的背景。
是我有被害妄想吗？从第二章开始，每一句话我觉得都有可以展开，可以黑，可以很黑。
男主是异族，是孤儿，被人收养。警察姊常问有没有奇怪的人在店里出现，还有研究团队。路边捡到的艾西亚是吸血族跑出来找自己的母亲。
绝对有黑幕的吧？绝对会反转的吧？直到结束这种感觉都未散去。
面对一直期待着的我，它的剧情戛然而止。

karakara可以比它现在做到的更优秀，但它没有去做。
如同施舍一般，给了我一个美满的结局。
“看啊兽耳娘，你们不就想要这样的东西吗”
或许正是看不惯这样的嘴脸，我才扯了这么一篇话吧。
告诫准备入的朋友，你只会得到你付出的份，一丝一毫都不会多。

karakara  8/10
achievement 7/7 [spoiler]给我好好ctrl过去就能全成就了吧[/spoiler]

30463008.review:
Post-Apocalypse, it's pretty much a mainstay nowadays, rite?
Times of lowliness, solitude and struggle after critical catastrophes, it's a topic that's interesting to explore and think about, but keep that sh¡t beyond a monitor pls [strike]whowekiddingwearealreadyfuqed[/strike].

Though sometimes one just needs a lighter take on the genre, there's been plenty of displays of misery and despair in this age of 2edgy4u games, what about something a bit more light-hearted for a spin? Like... [b]KARAKARA[/b].
Granted there are surely more VNs that explore this, but those plebs don't have Animal Ears, amirite?

[h1][b]Story[/b][/h1]
Let's start things of with probably the shakiest part of the Package, in context of the "Plot" this genre is embracing, the Post-Apocalyptic part of it is not really fully exploited, aside from that, it's better to look at this as more like a Slice of Life VN with a slight pinch of Fuᴄked up Post-Apocalyptic human-animal breeds, overall, [b]Average[/b].

[h1][b]Writing[/b][/h1]
Things start picking up from here, for as half-aѕѕed as the Post-Apocalyptic plot device is, the Writing consistenly has pretty entertaining character interaction and decent mood adaptability, [b]Well done guys[/b].

[h1][b]Cast[/b][/h1]
In both respects of Main Characters and Supporting/Secondary/Filler Chars, its pretty limited, 3 and 1 respectively, is not bad by any means though, all three Main Chars have unique personalities and traits ([strike]You go call them Cliche all u want boi[/strike]), [b]Two are company, but Three are just enough to keep it cool[/b].

[h1][b]Graphics[/b][/h1]
In short, [b]Polish up to the aѕѕ[/b], backgrounds are delightfully detailed with smooth colors, the detail is good, and the color makes it easy on the eyes, but you didn't come for that blunt stalling, you came here to know how succulent the VN Waifus are drawn, rite?
It's interesting, compared to the Backgrounds, dem Waifus sport pretty strong and well-defined, theming colors, it makes them pop-out a great deal.
Oh, and they also look scrumptious, most definitely.

[h1][b]Soundtrax[/b][/h1]
[b]Hit and miss[/b], Certain pieces like [b]Calm Days, Prank[/b] and [b]Happy Days[/b] are catchy and chill asf, but most of the rest are atmospheric, borderline forgettable music, the Music count is also not that big, it's not a problem by any means, but it works when it's supposed to, so it gets a pass from moi.

[h1][b]Duration[/b][/h1]
Here we take a slip off the rocky cliff, a normal trek though the game should take 3 or 4 hours at most, should you be a horny little bugger like me and download the fabled [b]+18[/b] patch and shove it into the game files, you could get one extra hour, is still rather short in hind-sight, for its price tag is not that bad, but get it On Sale in case you are not sure.

[h1][b]tl;dr[/b][/h1]
In conclusion, while rough around some edges, being the misleading synopsis and the basic no-progression Slice of Life quirk, [b]KARAKARA is still a pretty solid VN all-around[/b], give this one a shot Moe goodness and VN fans alike, [b]a very fun little distraction at its best, completely harmless at its worst[/b], and you guys need some "Research material" until Nekopara Vol. 3 arrives rite?

[b][u]Judge lest be judged, I shalt grant this VN the magistral[/u][/b]...

[h1][b][u]Popcorns[/u] [u]and[/u] [u]Tissues[/u]/10[/b][/h1]
[spoiler]no but srsly, get that +18 Patch, who doesn't want to get kinky with their cute little anthro companions?[/spoiler]

30197772.review:
[h1][b]　　KARAKARA——末世餐馆里的厨娇娘们[/b][/h1]

　　[h1]　　一、故事评述[/h1]
　　1.主线剧情
　　主人公Leon在父母去世后为继承家业与青梅竹马[spoiler]（童养媳）[/spoiler]Lucia一起经营餐馆，数年来一直相敬如宾。天降少女Aisia入职餐馆后察觉到他们隐藏多年的情愫，进而顺藤破瓜。随着了解的加深，Aisia的身世之谜逐渐浮出水面，Leon在与女警官Cullen的共同努力下守护着来之不易的齐人之福。
　　2.背景铺垫
　　[spoiler]末世阴郁的背景下述说一个孤身青年抱团取暖治愈系物语，单薄的舞台搭建让故事走向偏离了预定轨道；部分伏笔埋藏太浅，尤其是行李箱对于棺材的暗示过于明显；部分伏笔忘记回收，Leon曾若有所思道出Lucia无法下厨的难言之隐，而嗣后又对此绝口不提…[/spoiler]

　　[h1]　　二、视觉效果[/h1]
　　1.人物立绘稍异于主流审美，但在接受画风之后也别有一番风味。每当场景转换至车内的时候，Leon作为唯一的一位男性角色，其侧脸异常地猥琐。但是相对的，在女性角色的绘制上用心许多，丰满的角色Cullen、Aisia不失轻盈，纤弱的角色Lucia不显贫瘠。
　　2.用户界面中规中矩，细节处理有待加强。过场动画与用户界面尚未汉化；H场景存档时缩略图的模糊处理有些不明所以； 双语显示游戏文本时字号太小。

　　[h1]　　三、天气预报[/h1]
　　[spoiler]游戏通篇仅两场云雨，分别涉及Lucia、Aisia两位角色。[/spoiler]
　　[spoiler]Lucia作为Leon的青梅竹马，设定为大和抚子，对于感情持保守态度，在故事推进的过程中人物融入故事自然，动作场面上，娇羞的姿容展现得淋漓尽致。[/spoiler]
　　[spoiler]Aisia作为领养的小蝙蝠，设定为天然呆迷糊娘，其对于欲望的索求有些脱线到不合常理，其中“血液的代替品”也是业界用烂的梗，简直毫无新意可言。[/spoiler]
　　[spoiler]动作场面轻描淡写，遣词造句上似乎在有意地避开官能词汇，这与故事基调相得益彰。[/spoiler]
　　[spoiler]游戏中一幕“找尾巴”的桥段我很是喜欢，Aisia的萌卖得恰到好处，一改平时如狼似虎形象更加贴合人物性格，其中云雨欲纵又止让故事整体显得张弛有度。[/spoiler]
　　[spoiler]游戏第二章的尾声，Leon和Lucia成功挽留Aisia后事故闭幕显得顺理成章，却突然强势插入一场“日后谈”，像是借来的东风一样云雨过于突兀。在雨毕初晴时，Aisia对Lucia发表的 “观后感”表示尴尬，这段对话让闷热的场面降温不少，同时又让前后两场云雨遥相呼应。[/spoiler]

　　[u]游戏不支持云同步，仅仅两个章节的故事根本就是半成品，希望开发商能够倾注更多的诚意~[/u]

[h1]今天的空气也很干燥。
昨天跟之前也是，肯定连我出生的很久以前也一样。
这个地方的空气一直都很干燥。
肌肤的触感会变得像包过巧克力的锡纸一样又干又裂，
眼皮会变得想沾满土尘的棒球一样粗糙。
这里的一切都很干燥。
没有任何例外。
——然而。
心灵干枯的人们挨在一起，
互相填补彼此空洞的灵魂。
有时可以借由这么做
来让干涸的心灵活得滋润。
在这片干燥的大地上，
我涌现了这样的想法。	



我们三个人都是无依无靠，不够成熟，内心十分空虚。
即使自认彼此之间可以相互弥补，也还是有很多不了解对方的地方。
所以，我们接下来应该也会碰到类似这次的问题。
每发生一次问题，我们就要再度进行弥补。我们要一起生活，所以要相互扶持。
我们会一起创造共同的回忆，一起活下去。



为了明天和下个明天。
怀抱着借由互相弥补而获得、无可取代的平静。
——今天也要好好努力。
[/h1]

好吧。我错了。我还是打了评论区的某X18补丁。。
嗯，我只是好奇心比较重！并没有什么。。。

下面开始剧透啦，还木有开玩的各位小伙伴请及时闪避！

在一个发生了可啪灾难的未来
只遗留下少数人类。。8成人类都OVER了。。
嗯，男主角是真人类，木有尾巴加兽耳。

我直接以头发颜色命名吧。

推动剧情发展的核心兽耳娘是红毛~ 
可啪的吸血鬼族~
嗯，可啪。。第二章啪啪了。。
重大剧透：午夜常拖着“红色木棺”外出游荡的可啪吸血鬼！
最后还吸了男主。
咬了脖子和某处不可描述部位。。。
男主最后似乎找到了除开吸血外的替代方法。
呃，也是不可描述。。

另一只是蓝毛~
第一章就被男主拿下了~ 
在红毛的助攻下~

之前蓝毛同男主一起生活了4年。
却一直保持着纯洁的老板员工的关系。
虽然他们互相喜欢，却一直没有越雷池一步。
为什么？
一是两位都很纯洁。。
此外他们也怕万一对方不是自己想的那样，弄僵了会毁了工作关系吧。

黄毛是大姐姐的形象。
她还是一位警察。
虽然这作里她不给推倒。
2代估计就难逃主角魔爪了。
毕竟总共就3位女主，就剩下这一位没吃了。。

可能会有后续，毕竟黄毛还未推倒。。
外加红毛过来这个镇子是来找妈妈的，结束还没有下文。

呃，游戏格局很小。
说来说去，就是男主跟3只兽耳娘的小日常。。
其他路人几乎很少出现，立绘更是没有的。
音乐不是我的菜，呃。觉得乱糟糟的。不过我没有音乐细胞。。

相较其他日呆游戏，剧情方面也稍微逊色一些。
呃，估计我去写都能写的更好。。哈哈哈哈哈哈哈
路人：16你的面皮好厚啊~
其实温馨的日常就可以了。多加佐料未必更佳。

p19的画风有些奇特。。
好吧，我对兽耳不是非常萌。
所以觉得部分立绘比较草率，我去看他在pixiv里面的作品要好很多。
另外百度有个p19的贴吧。里面收罗了这位兽耳画师很多作品，也比游戏里好很多。

就这样，不过我还是推荐给好评啦~

29933607.review:
情人节打折入手，官方真是照顾我们这群宅。


说正题：
这部作品极其像Steam里众宅周知的Nekopara。虽然公司和画师不是一个人，但操作界面，菜单，剧情流程[strike] 和R18补丁	[/strike]来说这两部作品还是有很多相似之处的，特别是名字都非常像。


但这部《karakara》更加能吸引到我，其中一点是CG背景非常美，比如：夜里草原上的繁星和月亮，沙漠的那种空旷感，食堂房屋的斜体设计，还有[spoiler] 吸血鬼 [/spoiler]。BGM还不错，配合上精美的CG让人感觉身历其境。还有就是故事内容丰富，世界观和人物设定很有意思，让我迫不及待想玩续作。


最后，P19的萝莉实在太可爱了！

29919825.review:
[h1]【作品介绍】[/h1]

　　《KARAKARA》是由calme制作，Sekai Project发行的一款视觉小说游戏，背景设定在“黄昏时代”，这是一个人类衰落的时代。在这个时代，生活着一种被称为“他者”（以下简称兽耳娘）的杂交物种。她们属于人类，但是种群数量很少。在这片没有海风吹拂的贫瘠大地上，一群（兽耳娘）在这个她们不再熟悉的土地上谋求生计。

　　在远离小镇中心的一条公路上，男主和一只兽耳娘靠开餐馆为生（水月嘉祥你跑错片场了吧……）。对他们两个人来说，重塑世界的重要性远远赶不上增加送货车所能运载便当的数量更加重要，毕竟对他们而言，客户是上帝，他们需要让客户满意才能保证经营。日子在他们无尽的忙碌中划过。然而，他们单调却舒适的日子很快就被打破了，因为在一天回家的路上，男主看到了一个大箱子，而箱子里装着的，是一个粉红头发的小-女-孩。

[h1]【个人说明】[/h1]

　　这是一款十分适合倒杯茶，放松心情来看的视觉小说，流程很短节奏轻快，也没有什么大喜大悲，一共就两章。通篇没有一个分支选项，一路到底。可攻略角色就两个，一个蓝毛猫耳娘，一个粉毛狗耳娘，顺着剧情自然推。还有一个打酱油的大黄（警察姐姐）。除了活在CG中的男主外，游戏中不存在第四个有立绘的登场角色，舞台相当的小。Steam版的游戏CG有95张，打过补丁的完全版有132张，其实总共只有27张原画，很多CG只有表情和细节不同。[spoiler]使用补丁恢复的完整版游戏补全了删减内容，包含语音和CG收藏中的“鉴赏”，但截图这部分CG会自动打码。[/spoiler]成就方面，跟着流程走到游戏结束就会自然完成5/7，剩下两个分别切换下英语和日语的对话框语言就完成了。目前本游戏已追加了官方繁体中文，推荐入手。

[h1]【游戏补丁】[/h1]

[spoiler]正式版补丁 http://pan.baidu.com/s/1dFqWHTR 密码 1sve[/spoiler]
[spoiler]游戏解包文件（原版） http://pan.baidu.com/s/1jIr29ee[/spoiler]

[h1]【其他福利】[/h1]

[spoiler]p19（ピーイチキュー）P站地址 http://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=219976[/spoiler]

29830723.review:
[h1]何もかもが乾いている。ひとつとして例外は無い。
そう、ただのひとつも――。

KARAKARA[/h1]



安価ゲーならではの短いお話。でも展開もちゃんとある。しかも日常モノとしての空気も崩れないぐらいにシリアスさも抑えめ。こういうフォーマットで出会ったというのもあるがここまで応援したいタイトルにあったのは久々ですよいいこれ
BGMがかなーり良い なんかBGM使う機会あったらめっちゃ使いたい デジタルサントラとボイスCD販売はどこ…ｺｺ？

っていういいところは他の書くのが上手いお方に任せてちょっと気になったところを。

1つは場面転換のときに同じBGMが流れる際に、頭から再生し直されるところですかね 3行だけ読んでまた頭からっていうのはどうなんだろうなあって まあ3行後のテキストは長めなので気にはならない…かな？
もう1つは車のシーン等であるCGの差分を出す時に、いちいちウィンドウが消えて差分が変わってまた表示し直すって一連の動作が億劫かな この辺はPatch適応後のシーンだと顕著に現れます。

でこっちがPatch適応後のおはなしの話 後ろの方にガッツリじゃないけどシチュネタバレはあるよ
[spoiler]まずお値段については…同じ価格なのはどうかなあ 嘘でも本体1500円パッチ500円で出した方が良かったよね
まあともかく、それぞれヒロインに1パートずつあります。これが結構に短い。淡々とって言うのも悪いが結構テンポが良くてオオ、オオ…ってなっちゃったよ俺は パッチの値段を考えたのもこれが要因ですね…短い上にパパっと終わってしまう[/spoiler]
[spoiler]それとPatchを当ててると途中のシナリオでお前これおかしくね？ってなったりするところが存在する まあおちんちん関係ですね
Patchがないと話が飛んでキャラが接近したタイミングがわからないのにPatchを当ててると一部だけど矛盾が生まれる。 これもうわかんねえなあ(お手上げ)
そして3Pがなし！ﾃﾞﾃﾞﾄﾞﾝ(絶望)でもだ、だがしかしだ[/spoiler]
[spoiler]3Pとは言わないのだろうがそれぞれのお致しに同伴として片方のヒロインも同じ部屋にいるのだ これって、実質3Pじゃないですか？ダメ？
あとこれだけいいたかったけど、アイシアのCVで何か勘ぐった方、マイルドだけどきっちりありました
[/spoiler]

粗を探すと結構見つかっちゃうけれど全体的なまとまりは良いとてもオススメしたい一作。終わり方も良い為続いてほしいのと続いてほしくないのが合わさり死ぬ 死んだ ルーシャママたすけて…



[h1]――だけど。
乾いたひとつ同士が寄り添って、空っぽなもの同士が中身を埋めあって。
そうすることで渇きが潤いになることもあるんだ。[/h1]

==========神经病结束以后============
咳咳，首先注意，
本游戏有免费的试玩Demo，大概就是序章的内容，预览的截图内的内容都有，建议犹豫的朋友可以玩玩demo。
说几个这个游戏的缺点：
1.云存档不支持，差评!
2.没有steam专属集换式卡牌，差评!!!
3.有个小bug，游戏内按F12截图会只能截背景，截不到文字内容……很诡异，不知道是不是故意的。

其他的问题就没了，游戏真的灰常灰常棒，对于啃生肉毫无压力的玩家群来说，不是想引战，同是兽耳娘的作品，明显喜欢这种三两只小家伙非常轻松嬉闹作品。不知道为什么和隔壁某个live2D大作的剧本来说，更适合反复欣赏。
PS：已经被BGM洗脑循环中……
要是有中文就好了呐……就能更好的安利出去了_(:з)∠)_

29110911.review:
Being one of my purchases on little more than a whim (50% off for the game, 50% off for the un-patch via Denpasoft), this was a neat little experience. It's short, lighthearted, and sweet. It doesn't exactly expore anything deep, being essentially a few days in the life of the characters as they are running a diner in the middle of nowhere, but it was enjoyable. 
What I found to be most interesting about it is that it establishes a universe that, while it doesn't delve extensively into, but leaves a lot of potential. For instance, if another VN came out that addressed more things going on in the lives of and events surrounding the same characters or, perhaps, delving more into the catastrophe that took place some time before the events of this game, I'd be interested in having a look at that.
Depending on what you're looking for in a VN, I may be a tad hesitant to recommend this at full price, but on a sale? I'd recommend it. The experience is a bit brief and characters aren't complex, but it'll leave you with a smile...and, perhaps, even hoping for a sequel.

27789590.review:
[h1]生きよう。カラカラの、この大地で。[/h1]

何が起こったかはわからないけれど、確実に「何か」の災厄が起こった世界で食堂を経営する、
人間の男の子と大きな耳を持つ女の子の物語。
災厄が起こったカラカラの世界に適応するため、主人公の男の子以外皆大きな耳が付いています。

日本語/英語両対応の日本産の全年齢対応ノベルゲーム(R18パッチ有)。選択肢が一切ない一本道なので、ラノベでも読む感覚でプレイ出来ます。

[h1]良い点[/h1]
ゲーム自体の長さは値段相応、台詞すべて聞いても3時間近くでクリア出来るボリュームです。
キャラが可愛いだけではなく、ストーリーもしっかり作られているのでかなり楽しめます。

また、作者様曰く舞台設定は日本ではなくアメリカを舞台にしているそうです。
注意深く見てみるとアメリカらしいポイントが随所に散らばっていて楽しめました。

伏線の類も綺麗に回収出来ていてオチもうまく付けれています。
短時間でサクッとエンディングが見れる分、終わってから
「もっと高くて良いから長編か続編出してくれぇ！」　と叫びたくなるようなサクっと具合です。
[strike]続編出たらマジで金払うよ。[/strike]
[strike][b]2017/3/18のイベントで"KARAKARA2"に関しての発表があるそうです![/b]ありがとうございます！！[/strike]


[h1]2017/03/22 続編KARAKARA2が発表されました！！おめでとうございます！！[/h1]


[strike]開発者の方がコラムを日本語と英語で更新しているので[/strike]、ストーリー終了後も楽しめます。
[b]2017年2月15日分の更新で一度停止だそうです。[/b]素晴らしいコラムをありがとうございました。

また、英語と日本語の字幕を同時に出す機能があるので、ある程度英語が出来る方は見比べてみるのも面白いかもしれません。


[h1]良くなかった点[/h1]

一つ気になる点があるとすれば、R18パッチを導入している前提でのストーリー展開なようで、
特別大きな違和感を感じるほどでは無いですが
本来なら行為後に交わされるであろう会話がいきなり出てくるので時々「あれ？」と違和感を覚える事になります...。
主人公とメインヒロインがわかりやすくイチャつくのも僅か数回だけになっています。
日本産ゲームの入門向けという位置づけなので仕方無いですが、少し消化不良感がします。

後これは此方の環境問題のせいかもしれないですが、Steamオーバーレイの表示がズレてしまい、オーバーレイを起動して実績の確認がし辛いようになっています。


[h1]総評[/h1]
以上の良くなかった点を入れても、それを上回る良い作品になっています。
日本産のエロゲー特有のガッツリ来る展開ではなく、
可愛い絵とストーリーをカジュアルに楽しみたい方は是非購入をお勧めします。

乱文失礼しました。素晴らしいゲームをありがとうございます。

26669431.review:
Karakara!

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Karakara is a nice kinetic novel based in a post-apocalyptic world where two people are making their living by doing the best they can to run a diner. Civilisation is barely holding up and is only being supported by technology that lost in time, while the biggest of cities on earth only numbering in the thousands. Humanity has taken a massive hit and is very different to what it was in the past.

The novel itself is about how the characters go about in their day to day lifestyles and what it's like to survive in a world very much warped from their own. And one day, they bump into a girl on the side of the road and their lives suddenly become rather "interesting".

[h1]Backstory[/h1] 
The backstory on this game was just through the roof! The whole "post-apocalyptic" part had actually been thoroughly thought about in such a creative way and was put together very well! It is very vague on what actually happened in the previous era but seeing how they crafted civilization to only be half standing on the remains of their ancestors was something that really drew you in. For example, civilisation still relied on things like electricity and radio stations but had no idea how they actually worked, as all the information on the technology was lost during "the incident". So once something was broken, it was broken for good. I found this really clear and absolutely loved this part of the story! 8/10.

[h1]Art[/h1]
The art in this game is just AMAZING! If you can't tell from the screenshots, it really is incredible. All the CGs were done very nicely and the characters are just drawn BEAUTIFULLY! The only thing that annoyed me is Leon smiles too hard in some of the CGs, but the small details really don't matter when the art overall is amazing. 10/10.

[h1]Music[/h1]
The music in this game is very nice and suits everything very well. It's that sort of thing that you'll happily listen to without realising it because it just merged with the scene so well. Only thing that annoyed me is it can change a little [i]too[/i] quickly sometimes. But apart from that, I would happily buy the OST for this if it were available since it's nothing but pleasant to listen to! 8/10

[h1]Characters[/h1]
The characters are Karakara nice but they aren't anything to hoot over, sadly. They all had their ups and downs, but no matter what anyone says - Lucia will always be the best (Why wasn't there more of her, developers?!?). I found that Leon, the character you play as, was a bit dull and didn't have much personality. I also think Aisia should have shown more emotion at times, given the kind of extraverted character she was. Didn't quite feel natural for her to be smiling all the time. Overall though, the characters are nice and certainly aren't anything to complain about. 6/10.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Far too short :( The story was very nice and did have it's good (although predictable) turns of events. But it was just FAR. TOO. SHORT. With the amazingly creative backstory they could have done so so so, so much more with it. I finished the game in around 3 hours, so I was really disappointed in how short it was compared to the potential it had. Apart from that, I did feel the story was a little to focuses around Aisia but the story is still a really nice to read though, and I certainly enjoyed it. 7/10

[h1]TL;DR[/h1] 
Overall it is a VERY nice story and the art is just AMAZING. Definitely a nice read for beginners or anyone that wants a nice paced story that has a lot of flavour. It's just sad there's just so little of it ;(

Do recommend for anyone who loves the Visual Novel genre though. You'll definitely enjoy it.

26640989.review:
[h1] Moe rules the world [/h1]
Catgirls from Nekopara, here's puppygirls from KaraKara.
Sekai Project invades Steam with another "fuwa-fuwa" visual novel game.

[b][u]Story[/u][/b] (spoiler-free)
The setting is a bit similiar to Nekopara. Main protagonist running a restaurant together with an extremely cute puppygirl employee. Your heart goes "fuwa-fuwa mofuu-mofuu" along with the story.
Everything is sooo cute. ≧◡≦
[spoiler]There's a shocking plot twist too.[/spoiler]（　ﾟДﾟ）
The length of the story is the biggest disappointment, I must say. If this was an anime, this could be a 24 episodes anime, but it turns out to be having only 12 episodes. The climax happens at episode 11, and there goes the anti-climax ending. I was expecting more to happen after that climax. [spoiler] And I didn't realize that I have finished the game until it returns to the main menu. =0= [/spoiler]

[b][u]Gameplay[/u][/b]
There is no selection to be made, hence there is only one ending.
Press spacebar to progress, F9 to repeat kiut voices occasionally, F12 to screenshot something kiut too.
Personally, I find the game enjoyable and I never skip a single voice line.

[b][u]Characers[/u][/b]
Character design is [b]absolutely LOVELY.[/b]
[spoiler]Lucia is love.[/spoiler]
There's only a bit of character development since the story is short.

[b][u]Visual[/u][/b]
Although the character sprites are not animated as in Nekopara, they are still lively with smooth face transition and sprites movement. The detailed face expression is also worth mentioning. Background art is filled with details but is not so visual-stunning. 

[b][u]Audio[/u][/b]
[b]Perfect voicing of characters[/b]. All female characters are fully voiced. Personally, I really respect every voice actresses behind each of the character.
OP and ED song is only average in my opinion.

[h1]Overall 7/10[/h1]
I would recommend it only when it is on steam sale. I bought it at 50% off.
3-4 hours of enjoyment worth around 3USD :).
[strike]I doubt there will be a sequel though.[/strike] The sequel released on Nov 2017.

26522116.review:
This is a short kinetic visual novel featuring Leon Laird, an owner of a diner who make a living together with catgirl hybrid co-owner and assistant Lucia Haynes by making and delivering food to the inhabitants of the town of Sagami Francisco in a barren wasteland. While returning home to their diner from a delivery one day, Leon and Lucia happen to come across a pink-haired girl Aisia Mayfield sleeping on a red suitcase by the side of the road. Feeling sorry for the girl, they both offer to take in Aisia as a second helper at the diner. Over two episodes, Leon will interact with Lucia, Aisia, Cullen Lancaster (local police officer at Sagami Francisco and the surrounding area) and a stray puppy in a heart-warming tale of friendship, love, kindness, compassion, diligence and sacrifice with a share of humour and fanservice. 

Although there are no choices to make at all in this game, the CG, opening and ending videos, soundtracks and overall game presentation are great. The story and plot is written like a romantic comedy and has a nice happy ending. Reading through the storyline and dialogue, unlocking all extra content and obtaining all achievements will take less than 10 hours.

I have nominated this game for The World is Grim Enough Let's Just All Get Along award in November 2017 Autumn Sale.

26171076.review:
KARAKARA is set in a dry, arid are of the world called Sagami Francisco sometime after an unspecified disaster decimated much of humanity. Leon lives a quiet life amidst the heat together with Lucia, until one day they happen across a pink-haired girl who turns their lives upside down.

The art is one of the standouts in this VN. [b]p19’s art is just gorgeous, using soft pastel colours for her adorable character designs.[/b] The American-West inspired backgrounds are also bright and crisp, and it all looks extremely professional. Further setting the scene is the music and [b]the voice actresses did a fantastic job with bringing the characters to life.[/b]

Speaking of characters, Leon was a typically stoic protagonist, although he did have some fun lines. Lucia was great as the composed osananajimi who loses her cool when it comes to Leon, Cullen had some brief screentime as the dirty-minded onee-san, and Aisia was an adorable ball of energy. She could have been annoying, but I just found her carefree attitude and the way she spoke too cute to be irritating.

[b]It’s such a fluffy and heartwarming experience, and I think they totally achieved the goal they mentioned in the interviews of wanting you to feel like you’re really there in the world with these girls.[/b] That sense of immersion one of the things that draws me to visual novels like no other medium, and KARAKARA hits all the right notes.

However, while I loved the characters, the world, and the writing (the English translation was great), I honestly found the length disappointing. [b]It took me under three hours to complete the whole thing, and it felt like it should have been the demo for a much longer game.[/b] There are multiple plot threads that are briefly referred to but never go anywhere, and the things that do happen are oddly rushed. Also, while there are hints at the lore of the world, none of it is explored enough to make it feel relevant.

The game has everything going for it, it just needs to be longer so that plot developments are given time to breathe and it tells an actual cohesive story. I really hope calme is able to create a sequel that will expand and improve upon what we’ve seen here. It would be great to see KARAKARA turned into a full-length visual novel, even if it takes multiple episodic releases to get it there.

[url=https://merumeruchan.wordpress.com/2016/07/19/review-karakara/]Click here for the full review.[/url]

24701781.review:
Steam really needs to let reviewers specify "mixed" or "neutral" in their recommendations for games like this.

First the good, the art is excellent and the game is fairly well voice acted. The experiment with putting both the Japanese and English text on screen at the same time was inetersting, and I'm glad that experimentations like this...even though I don't really feel that it worked; it was distracting and I turned it off about 10 minutes in. The music is pretty good, though there isn't much variety.

The story doesn't really feel like it forms a cohesive whole, and if you perform even the most cursory poking at the backstory, everything falls apart. The largest human settlement has 2,000 people in it...and yet, the American continent still has international trade with the Japanese isles. "Sagami Fancisco" has 2,000 people in it and the main character owns a car(!!!). That's nowhere near enough people to maintain a petrochemical industry, or any sort of manufacturing base that could support an auto industry. Even weirder, the main character (or at least his parents) chose to set up a dinner 50 miles outside of the nearest human settlement. And they still...get buisness?

"But it's moe! You aren't supposed to take it seriously!"

I am totally on board with that! Really! The problem is that the game puts its setting front and center, again and again, at the expense of the moe characters. Nekopara mumbled "something something genetic enginering, now stop asking about it," and then never brought it up again so we could enjoy the catgirls in peace, without bringing up things that would break immersion.

And despite that criticism, when the world takes a back seat to the character interaction between Lucia and Aisia and the MC, it sorta works. Which sucks, because you then have the other half of the story dragging the moe character interaction down.

[h1]장점[/h1]

-[b]세계관과 장르의 불일치[/b]
-미묘한 일러스트
-짧은 분량


[h1]주의점[/h1]

체험판과 정식판이 큰 차이가 없으므로 체험판을 꼭 플레이해보시고 구매를 결정하세요.

성인버전은 아래 링크에서 구매하실 수 있습니다. (구매 전 주의사항 반드시 확인)
http://denpasoft.com/shop/karakara-18-dlc/


[h1]이런 분들에게 추천합니다.[/h1]

조금 부족한 키네틱노벨이라도 차후 후속작까지 모두 구입할 생각으로 구매하실 분


[h1]이런 분들에게 비추천합니다.[/h1]

특이한 키네틱노벨을 기대하시는 분


[h1]사담[/h1]

스토리는 정말 특이할 것 없는 평범한 일상 키네틱노벨입니다. 문제는 폴아웃같은 포스트 아포칼립스 세계관인데 금수저도 아니고 부모 여위고 히로인과 단 둘이 물려받은 식당을 운영하는 주인공이 세기말에 사는지 그냥 일본 현지에서 사는지 알 수 없을 정도로  1,2챕터내내 시나리오레이터가 세계관 이용을 못하며 심지어 히로인중 한명인 천재 아이시아가 세기말 돌입을 막아버립니다. 그로 인해 이 키네틱노벨만의 특이점이 없어 개성이 없습니다. 일상물의 대가인 키오 나치씨이지만 이런 세계관의 작품은 처음인가봅니다. 그나마 정석 이벤트와 키오 나치씨가 좋아하는 이벤트와 상업적인 이벤트가 있습니다만 오히려 그게 더 부정적인 역할을 하고 있는 것 같습니다. 그래도 이 바닥에서 잔뼈굵은 키오 나치씨이니 2편을 기대해봅니다. 일러스트도 대체로 유려한 일러스트지만 몇몇 구도는 부자연스럽다는 느낌을 지울 수 없습니다. 일러스트레이터가 정면구도를 잘 그리나 다른 구도는 아직 연습이 필요한 것 같습니다. 특히 HCG가 너무 평범한 것도 마이너스네요. 2편에서는 좀 더 나아지겠죠. 그 외는 스토리가 시작도 하기전에 끝난 것 같을 정도로 분량이 매우 짧은 점이 아쉽네요.

너무 안좋은 점만 이야기해서 그렇지 프롤로그 노래라던지 배경CG라던지 BGM등 대부분 기본 혹은 그 이상입니다. 특히 성우들이 다들 이 바닥에서 오래하신 분들이라 연기력이 뛰어납니다. 부족한 일러스트는 연기력으로 메꿔버리는 패기를 느낄 수 있었습니다.그러나 부족한 스토리를 메꿀 수는 없었네요.

뛰어난 인물들이 모였고 펀딩까지 받았는데 이런 작품이 나오게 된 것은 명백히 메인 디렉터의 문제인 것 같습니다... 키오 나치씨의 세기말 첫 도전을 함께 걸어가실분에게는 추천을, 포스트 아포칼립스 키네틱노벨을 느끼고 싶으신 분에게는 플라네타리안을 추천드립니다.

24137046.review:
As of writing this review my playtime is low but I played it outside of Steam and therefore havent racked up hours on Steam. This game caught my eye due to the animal/human characters, which I really like. The artstyle is amazing too, there is so much detail and it matches the theme of the Visual Novel.
The bright colours, the aerie, almost haunting music pieces of piano music underline the theme of dystopian future. You can almost feel the heat in those bright colour shots, as if the sunlight flows out of the pictures. The story told here comes to life with the wonderful voice acting and above mentioned music pieces.
The story itself is a little tale of two (three) people that give each other comfort in these vast lands. The peace of those two living in a mutual releationship gets disrupted by a third one, which tries its hardes to fit in.
I will be honest, I enjoyed the story and playing the All-Ages version on Steam doesnt take anything away from the story. I myself played the 18+ version with the erotic content, which might offer a deeper insight in their relationships. For those that expect some hardcore action or anything you will be disappointed, it matches the flow/tone of the novel to have light erotic content.
As said before, the audio is a great positive point. The piano pieces with the occasionally track with more instruments matches the vast and empty lands where the visual novel plays.
I often found myself wondering if some tragedy would befall them, often trying to assure myself that this isnt that kind of visual novel even if some mystery sprouts up. I really enjoyed that and thus cared for the characters.
Some critize the gametime of this title, but for 10 Euro (brought it on sale at release (20% discount)) I got more then enough of my moneys worth. The great art, audio and good story are worth the price in my opinion. I always remember, going to the cinema costs the same for roughly 2 hours without food and you cant rewatch it. I certainly will replay the story a little down the line when I forgot some of it (especially one of the mysteries in it).
Its kinda bittersweet with the desolated world and the sweet relationships.

Now, obviously I still have a few things I find negative or rather I long for them like those in the novel.
Firstly, I would love to stay longer in this universe, explore more about the story, how the world came to be, how the three will master new situations (e.g. children) and how their relationships grow. At the same time, I dont really want much hardcore drama like death and stuff, I wouldnt like that... . Because the three, especially the girls are so frail.... .
This doesnt mean it was to short, I just want more of the characters and hope for a sequel.
My other point would be, as a Nekopara player, I would like more elaborate or rather higher quality erotic scenes, especially if they fit into the story. Higher quality in a sence of animation and drawn art, not that the art is bad, just more variations in the same way as you animate, more small steps to make the characters become more alive. That would elevate the erotic scenes more.

Now, can I recommend the game?
I totally can and hope for a sequel!
Even the All-Ages version should be great as the erotic scenes rather show a new side of their relationship then dictate the story.
For a Kickstarter game the art, artstyle, music and story is great.

Message for the developer, build onto that! Just be careful not to destroy the balance of the existing characters.

24096038.review:
This is a hard game for me to review. I'd give it a neutral if I could, but that's not an option. I really did love it. The art and setting were superb, and the characters were interesting.

The problem was its length. The whole game only took me 2.5 hours to get through (including the 15min of optional content), and even a very slow reader could finish it in under 4.

There was so much they could have done with the setting, and so many interesting plot elements that were introduced but never explored. I would have gladly paid more if they would have spent more time developing the story. I guess I'm somewhat disappointed, and hope the developers come back to this setting sometime in the future.

24095261.review:
Is it the best visual novel ever to grace Steam? No, of course not. That isn't to say it is bad, in fact the characters' design were very well done in my opinion, and the CG and soundtrack were all very nice. The problem I found with this VN is the pacing of the story, as well as how long the entire story lasts. I expect KARAKARA to follow the footsteps of something like NEKOPARA, which will probably mean we see new additions to the series. Would I recommend purchasing KARAKARA? Yes, but I'd probably wait until some sort of sale(I purchased it during its initial lauch on steam so there was a small discount), because for the pricing it has right now, I think it is a bit much. But if you liked NEKOPARA or any other kawaii/moe types of VNs, then by all means go buy it!

Pro:
-Adorable characters that have cute designs and are well-voiced
-CG looks very good
-Soundtrack isn't bad
-Somewhat interesting twist during the story

Cons:
-Story was VERY short, they could have added more stuff I feel
-If you try out the demo, you essentially know everything about the full game except for a few things. A lot of backstory isn't really covered, no hints at what might occur in the future, and it just kind of leaves the reader hanging and waiting to see what more will come from the KARAKARA creators

24085730.review:
作为一个玩过上百个gal的老司机我来简单评测一下这个游戏

首先这个游戏是在gal吧被安利的精（luo)美(li)的画风便被吸引了过来并果断买了下来,总的来说也还算满意。

1.画面：游戏的画面不用说P19的画风谁看（yong)谁知道不过唯一的瑕疵就是画风稍显凌乱如果能在平稳一定相信会更好
2.剧情：这种末日余生的剧情很容易让人觉得剧情会很悲伤，我刚开始玩的时候也是在备好了纸巾的情况下开始玩的。然而这游戏却让我感觉不到多大的绝望更多的则是平常愉快的日常而且我还觉得有些狗血至于是怎样的剧情我就不剧透了。总而言之这游戏的剧情就是一份午后的甜点平淡却有些许的生机。
3.音乐：游戏的音乐相当舒缓听起来十分的空旷而又另人安心说真的这部游戏很大的亮点在于它的音乐。
我拙劣的文字仅仅代表我的一己之见不代表游戏的实际表现。我只是希望有更多的人来玩玩这个游戏来品尝一下这份甜点。jing

最后
我才不知道什么和谐补丁呢

24016038.review:
I found out of this kinetic visual novel about week ago and after waiting for multiple reviews to come in I decided to give it a shot.
After playing it, I'd like to give this title a [b]neutral[/b] recommendation more than positive or negative, but had to choose one.

To begin with, the characters are cute, art is good and the background story is told throughout the novel rather well BUT the story suffers from somewhat bad pacing, narration on few scenes were suddenly rushed ruining the feel for being a good romance novel and the content feels sometimes bit too oversexualized like countless Sakura -titles.

The R18 patch adds few scenes to the novel, but I wouldn't recommend it for the story's sake, but for supporting the artist.

Otherwise about the novel; it's positive that male protagonist was shown in the drawings and whole novel is properly voiced and "dual-text" as English & Japanese at same time was an interesting feature to have, but compared to it's length and for those above said reasons I would've hoped bit more detailed animations or more different art to fill that gap of longing something more.

KARAKARA is good novel to players who haven't read much visual novels so far, but for one seeking a fluent, heartwarming story more than abundant figures I would recommend to think another time. It might be a wonderful novel for you, or not - you're the one to make that decision of getting it.

23977203.review:
Die Handlung ist recht simpel und vorhersehbar. Die Charaktere sind gut gestaltet, für meinen Geschmack aber etwas flach. Trotzdem entpuppt sich KARAKARA aber als ein solider Slice of Life Titel mit liebenswerten Charakteren und einer hervorragenden Synchronisation. Die Illustrationen sind kunstvoll gestaltet und KARAKARA hat trotz seiner Kürze gut unterhalten. Ich hätte mir hier ein bisschen mehr Informationen zur Hintergrundgeschichte und der Vergangenheit gewünscht, auch hätte eine etwas tiefer gehende Story nicht geschadet. Insgesamt konnte die Visual Novel aber überzeugen. Für Fans von Moe ist die Novel so oder so eine klare Empfehlung, aber sonst ist es auch ein gutes Werk für einen ruhigen Abend.

23964771.review:
選択肢が全くないビジュアルノベル。テキスト量はライトノベル1冊に満たないほどの量ではあるものの、その短さと選択肢ゼロのおかげで「ビジュアルノベルで遊んだことないんだけど……」という人でもとっつきやすい。
良く言えば、フルボイスで、綺麗なイラストを見ながら、文章を読み進めて、雰囲気に合ったBGMで楽しめる！
悪く言っちゃえば、読むだけ、見るだけ、聴くだけ、それだけ。(でもビジュアル『ノベル』ってそういうもんじゃない？……えっ、違う？)

お話は小難しいことは話していなくて、『人間』と人間とはちょっと変わった『異人』の出会いや日常、生活をメインに、たまに浮き上がる彼らの変化と合わせて、この世界そのもののストーリーを少しづつ見ていくことができるでしょう。といっても、あんまり掘り下げて歴史の話をしたりはしないので、ニヤニヤしながら乾いた大地を生きる人たちの日々を眺めることができると思うよ！

ストーリー振り返りやサウンドトラックとして使えるCGギャラリーモード、サウンドギャラリーモードも完備。素敵なBGMを聞きながらお話の余韻に浸ることだってできちゃう。
R-18 versionもあるらしいけど、Steamでのリリースは規約の都合で難しそう(っていうか無いみたい。)KARAKARAのホームページにその他の販売元、R-18 version/Patchの購入方法が書かれているから、気になる人はチェックしてみて！

あとカレン姉さんはいいぞ。

It is a good VN made by professionals. Characters are cute, and plots are funny. In an interview, the writer said the story is short (the length of a volume of light novel), so it doesn't really have a story. Rather, it served the purpose of introducing the universe, which is some sort of bigger plot in a post apocalyptic world. For its length, it may be better to get it when it goes on sale.

23946656.review:
日本のノベルゲーの技術を活かして、日本人のクリエイターとSekai Projectが共同で制作したノベルゲーです。基本的に選択肢はまったくなし、文章を読んでいくのみでゲームとは言えないが、ライトノベルを読む感覚で進めます。

ストーリー内容は難しいものではありませんでした。人類が滅びかけ、存続する対策として「異人」として生きる人たちの物語。そのため、ケモ耳つけた女の子は普通の人間の耳もあります。どうして人類が滅びかけたのか、その原因の「災厄」とはなんなのか。深いところまで語られていないので、続編がありそうです。今作に限っては、登場人物も少なく、ヒロイン２人のルーシャとアイシア、サブのカレンさんくらい。プレイ時間も短く、量としてはライトノベル1冊弱くらいで短いです。ルーシャがかわいい。

Steamで販売されるにあたって、英語字幕もついています。もちろん全部日本語化済（というか元々開発日本人だしね）。Steam以外でも販売してるところがあります（Denpasoft、DMM、DLsite 等）。18禁版もあるようです。Steamだと、18禁パッチが日本向けには用意されていないようなので注意。あと、ルーシャがくそかわいい。

とにかく、音楽がいいです。日常パートのBGMもとてもよく、レオン（主人公）たちの生活によく馴染んでいます。キャラ絵もただ立ち絵として表示してるわけではなく、1つのセリフでもよく動き、表情も変わり見てて飽きませんでした。そこは、デモ動画、体験版を見ていただければわかると思います。ルーシャの百面相かわいい。

値段とゲーム内容のボリュームを考えるとちょっと高めかもしれませんが、ライトノベル1冊＋セリフがフルボイスでついてるので妥当なのではと思います。セールのときに買うといいかもしれません。

ルーシャが可愛くて死ぬ。
